title: Operational Risk Management Freelance Consultant
description:
**Job Description**
 As an Operational Risk Management Consultant, you will work with industry-leading clients across your sectors to reduce risks and improve business continuity and asset productivity. You’ll save lives, drive performance and improve the working lives of all your clients’ employees.
   

  

 As a freelance consultant, you will work with our team to deliver coaching and support to our clients to help evolve their culture and behaviours when it comes to safety and risk management. This will involve working closely with managers and supervisors on site with the client, supporting and coaching them in the implementation of dss+ methodologies.
   

  

 Key responsibilities will include;
   

  

* You will work as a coach to help change the culture and underlying behaviours relating to safety and risk management.
* You will be working on the client site as part of the dss+ team - this will involve staying overnight throughout the week


**Job Requirements**
 At dss+, we embrace and celebrate diversity. Above all, we are an inclusive culture in which everyone contributes and has the chance to develop their talents further.
   

  

 Ideally, you will hold a degree/master’s degree in engineering or a business-related field, coupled with experience in management consulting and coaching with previous exposure to operational risk management, safety, and/or culture change.
   

  

 You demonstrate experience and an understanding of the operational issues in heavy industries such as mining or heavy industry.
   

  

 You have a deep understanding of safety and operational risk management (ORM) within mining or heavy manufacturing sectors and will be able to leverage that experience in coaching others to adopt new behaviours as part of a new culture.
   

  

 You will be fluent in Swedish and English and can work in both languages fluently.

title: Relationship Manager
description:
Mentimeter is an engagement tool with a clear goal in mind. To turn presentations into conversations. Through real-time interactivity and clear visualizations, we get people to participate, engage and become more productive. Transforming all those passive meetings, airless classrooms and drawn out trainings into valuable and memorable moments.
   

  

 We truly believe that you achieve the best results by doing things together. And that successful leaders need to adopt a curious and collaborative mindset in order to get there. So with you at Mentimeter, you’ll be a big part of the ambition to help over 1 billion people listen, learn and work better together.
   

  

 As an Relationship Manager, you will lead the expansion of our existing Enterprise customers by focusing on revenue growth while serving as a trusted adviser to our customers.
   

  

 We expect you to have high energy, an entrepreneurial tempo with the main focus on commercial initiatives to drive revenue growth among our Enterprise customers. We are looking for someone who can create long-term and strategic relationships with customers from all over the world.
   

  

**Responsibilities For The Role**
* Full commercial ownership of our current enterprise customers
* Build long-term, strategic relationships with customers all over the world
* Drive revenue growth by building a strong pipeline, while serving as a trusted adviser to our customers
* Manage a continuous pipeline for new expansion and up-sell opportunities
* Ownership of renewals of ongoing agreements in order to prevent churn
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data in order to support decision-making towards customers
* Develop a strategy for best-in-class scalable customer expansion
* Collaborate together with Customer Success Managers on strategic enterprise customers


**Resources We Have To Support You**
* World-class lead-generation from the Marketing and Product teams
* Marketing and Sales team to support in analysis and tactics
* Sales Development Representatives to support in lead qualification
* Sales Operation function
* Professional CRM and data gathering services (Intercom, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, Salesforce)


**Must-haves For The Role**
* Previous SaaS sales experience
* Ability to assess business opportunities and use data to make informed decisions and persuade others
* Passion for building long-term relationships as well as driving commercial initiatives with customers
* Knowledge of software contract terms and conditions with the ability to create fair transactions
* Strong negotiation, pipeline and forecasting skills
* Ability to manage a large number of customers simultaneously while positioning company products against direct and indirect competitors
* You are required to have professional-level English (we sell to 150+ countries today)
* Excellent communication skills


**Good To Have**
* Additional languages (other than Swedish and English)
* Bachelor or masters degree (field not important)


**Not Required**
* You don’t have to know Swedish (we are an English-first organization, daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 20 different nationalities!)


 Please note that this position is located onsite at our Stockholm HQ, with the starting date being flexible yet ideally as soon as possible.
   

  

**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Personality test and logical ability test
* Introduction Interview
* Business Case
* Competence Interview
* Culture Interview


**Compensation Model**
 We strongly believe in the power of togetherness, and we put a lot of effort into collaboration, teamwork and helping each other whenever needed. We believe that every part of Mentimeter, from Sales Development Representatives and Account Executives to Frontend Developers and Marketing Managers contributes equally to our continued success. To foster and emphasize this culture and way of working, we apply a non-commission based salary model in our sales roles, which has proven to be very successful and appreciated across the team. You can read about our benefits and perks here.
   

  

**What Mentimeter Can Offer**
 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
   

  

 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
   

  

**Culture at Mentimeter**
 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
   

  

 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page.
   

  

 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Lönespecialist/ Systemförvaltare till Schibsted
description:
Löneadministration
   

  

 Lönespecialist/ Systemförvaltare till Schibsted
   

  

 Är du en erfaren lönespecialist med stort intresse för system, utveckling och service? Vill du arbeta i en organisation som värderar öppenhet, samarbete och innovation – och där din insats gör skillnad varje dag? Då kan detta vara jobbet för dig! Hos Schibsted får du kombinera dina färdigheter inom löneadministration och systemförvaltning i en fartfylld miljö där förändring och utveckling genomsyrar vardagen.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, provanställning tillämpas, och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse. Schibsteds kontor är beläget mitt i centrala Stockholm. Fina förmåner erbjuds och möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån en dag i veckan. Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Om tjänsten
   

  

 Hos Schibsted blir du en viktig del av ett erfaret och engagerat löneteam som tillsammans hanterar omkring 2 000 löner för journalister och tjänstemän till de svenska bolagen i koncernen. Du erbjuds en spännande och omväxlande roll som inkluderar både systemförvaltning och löneadministration. I nära samarbete med HR, ekonomi och IT säkerställs en trygg, korrekt och effektiv lönehantering.
   

  

 Som lönespecialist kommer du att kombinera löneadministration med ett särskilt ansvar för systemförvaltning i HR+ 8. Du arbetar med lönekörningar varje månad och deltar vid semesterårsskifte och årsslut. Vidare ansvarar du för att säkerställa att systemet fungerar optimalt genom att hantera uppgraderingar, genomföra tester och följa upp felanmälningar i kontakt med systemleverantören.
   

  

 I rollen ingår också löpande hantering av reseräkningar, utlägg, förmånsbeskattning, förmånsbilar och arbetsgivarintyg. Du har daglig kontakt med både medarbetare och chefer, både via ärendehanteringssystem och personliga samtal. Tillsammans med dina kollegor bidrar du aktivt till att utveckla och kvalitetssäkra löneprocesser, rutiner och arbetssätt.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi söker dig som har en påbyggnadsutbildning inom lön och minst fem års erfarenhet av självständigt arbete inom löneadministration. Du är trygg i att arbeta med både system och löneprocesser, erfarenhet av HR+ 8 är högst meriterande. Vi förväntar oss att du har god vana av att tolka olika kollektivavtal och att arbeta i Excel samt har en grundläggande kunskap inom löneredovisning. Eftersom det är en internationell miljö med många kontaktytor är det viktigt att du kan uttrycka dig obehindrat på svenska och engelska, i såväl tal som skrift. Självklart hanterar du information och frågeställningar inom lön med hög integritet och gott omdöme.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är:
   

  

* Strukturerad och noggrann, med god förmåga att prioritera och arbeta mot deadlines
* Hjälpsam och prestigelös, med en hög servicekänsla och utpräglad samarbetsförmåga
* Utvecklingsintresserad och trivs i en föränderlig och dynamisk miljö
* Ansvarstagande och lösningsorienterad


 Om verksamheten
   

  

 Oberoende journalistik – det är vårt uppdrag
   

  

 Mediekoncernen Schibsted Media har några av Nordens starkaste varumärken i portföljen, som Aftonbladet, Svenska Dagbladet, VG, Aftenposten, Bergens Tidende, Stavanger Aftenblad, Omni, E24 och Podme.
   

  

 Varje dag använder nästan sju miljoner människor våra redaktionella medier för att bli uppdaterade, engagerade och underhållna – genom text, ljud, bilder och video. Förtroendet från våra användare är helt avgörande för oss. Och för att upprätthålla det förtroendet är vi fokuserade på fakta, verifierbarhet och transparens.
   

  

 Våra 2700 anställda är baserade i Oslo, Bergen, Stavanger, Stockholm, Helsingfors, Kraków och Gdańsk. Och vi är beroende av dem alla för att lyckas, genom nära samarbete över redaktioner, produkt- och teknologimiljöer och prenumerations- och annonsenheter.
   

  

 Det som började som Christian Schibsteds lilla boktryckeriverksamhet i dåvarande Christiania (Oslo) 1839, är idag ett av Nordens ledande medieföretag. Vår journalistik har informerat folk, byggt gemenskap, avslöjat maktmissbruk och stärkt demokratier i nästan tvåhundra år. Våra demokratier är beroende av oberoende journalistik. Det är vårt uppdrag.

title: Head of IFM Strategy Performance
description:
**About This Opportunity**
 Ericsson's Real Estate (RE) team is accountable for the company's global Real Estate portfolio, creating and operating an engaging physical and digital workplace experience! It supports innovation and productivity and enables users to be their best. It partners with Ericsson businesses on value creation, sustainability, and brand experience. The company has a hybrid working policy and is on a journey to new ways of working and a step towards a change in workplace experience.
   

  

 Global Workplace Operations (GWO) is within the RE organisation. It is accountable for strategy development and delivering Workplace Experience, Facilities Management, Workplace Services, and RE Sustainability across Ericsson's global portfolio. GWO ensures RE solutions are customised to reflect business and user profiles at 350 locations worldwide. GWO uses an outsourced IFM model to deliver solutions, allowing the in-house team to focus more on stakeholder engagement.
   

  

 This role leads a new unit and team; GWO owns and drives the RE sub-strategies for Services and Sustainability and elevates, inspires and manages the relationships with the IFM partners who deliver services and experience across the Global portfolio. It reports to the Head of Global Workplace Operations and is a member of the GWO leadership team.
   

  

**What you will do:**
**Leadership:**
* The successful candidate will work closely with Real Estate Portfolio and Project Management, Workplace Community and innovation, and Strategy and transformation units.
* Lead a unit consisting of 4 Geographic IFM Relationship leads, a Sustainability lead, 2 Performance analysts and Transformation Programme Manager.
* Lead the change management journey across GWO to ensure that key stakeholder groups buy-in and facilitate the agreed-upon transformation. Delegate ownership and delivery tasks, leveraging in-team Project Management resources.
* Mentor your team to proactively drive delivery, manifest change, and transform. Ensure these activities improve how real estate adds value to the Ericsson business and ensure our Real Estate remains effective.


- 

**Strategy:**
- Own, manage, and architect solutions to deliver RE sub-strategies and beyond in GWO and drive agreed-upon transformation through the unit.

* Key transformation areas are Workplace Experience (services and amenities, health and wellbeing, and social and community engagement) and digitalisation of user services.
* Liaison and collaboration with the GWO Global Lead to ensure regional solutions are aligned and impactful.
* Establish and maintain visibility of strategic change work completed by IFM partners across other markets and clients, and bring these to Ericsson.
* Present transformative solutions to strategic challenges to RE Leadership, work with internal partners to help deliver, and showcase these during delivery.
* Lead a Change Review process to understand the feasibility of scaling, further investment, operational readiness, and diversification of change efforts based on the lessons learned from the transformation programme.


- 

**Partnership Management & Ways of Working:**
* Lead engagement and relationship management with Ericsson's IFM partners via Geographic leads and Performance analysts.
* Partner with IFM Partners and Ericsson Communications and drive work to ensure initiatives are visible, successes are understood, and the momentum of change is maintained.
* Develop and roll out Global best practices to harmonise working methods, leverage the relationship with our 2 IFM Partners, and lead supplier governance and the RFS cycle for GWO.


**Governance and Contract Management:**
* Provide simplified contract mechanism interpretation to RE GWO Geos Teams on a scheduled and ad hoc basis. Build the partnership elements and enhance collaboration with the IFM Partner.
* Drive and ensure the governance structure in the IFM contracts is followed and aligned with the RE GWO strategy and goals.


- 

**Financial Management:**
* Support the REPO RE Finance Admin Team by sharing best practices and collaboration.
* Collaborate, network, and share knowledge with GFGO BC Sourcing & Real Estate, streamlining all Finance reporting and aligning global IFM budget-setting processes and forecasts.
* Work with procurement teams to support the pricing of the transformation program. Demonstrate the value of GWO’s change structure to RE Leadership.


**Sustainability:**
* Ensure the development of the RE Sustainability strategy to meet Ericsson's Net Zero in its own operations target by 2030 and other environmental objectives. Meet Group targets, ensure accurate reporting and drive initiatives to reduce the RE environmental footprint (e.g. waste and water reduction).


**The skills you bring:**
* Excellent communication skills and a high level of personal stakeholder engagement strategy, inspiring your team and partners to achieve innovative solutions.
* Subject matter expertise, with a strong understanding of market trends and FM procurement models
* Radical and innovative thinking with a challenger mindset
* Experience in leading and governing Global IFM relationships at a senior level (either as a customer or supplier)
* An inspiring leadership style with the ability to influence colleagues and internal stakeholders
* The ability to make change and manage improvement.
* Integrity in all business activity
* Commercial mindedness and able to articulate contract terms for practical application.


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 United Kingdom (GB) || Reading
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 759865

title: E2E Supply Planning manager – maternity cover until summer 2026
description:
**Company Description**
***Statistics show that women and underrepresented groups tend to apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications. Sobi encourages you to change that statistic and apply. Rarely do candidates meet 100% of the qualifications. We look forward to your application!***
 At Sobi, the work we do every day redefines the standards of care and transform the lives of people living with rare diseases.
   

  

 As a diverse team of entrepreneurial people, we are passionate about our growth journey towards becoming a global leader, making a difference for rare disease patients, moving quickly and always challenging the status quo.
   

  

 We are committed to an inclusive, sustainable and flexible workplace that fosters growth and development.
   

  

**Job Description**
**About the role**
 As the E2E Supply Planning Manager, you’ll be the governing all steps of our supply chain (Drug Substance (DS) to Drug Product (DP) into Finished Goods (FG). Ensuring a seamless flow to meet commercial and clinical demands.
   

  

 It’s a chance to lead, innovate, and make a tangible difference. You’ll be responsible for creating and executing supply plans that balance short- and long-term needs, managing inventory strategies, and driving operational excellence. Whether it’s collaborating with cross-functional teams, solving complex supply challenges, or optimizing KPIs, your work will ensure that patients receive the medicines they need, when they need them.
   

  

 This position is based at our Global Headquarters in Stockholm, Sweden reporting to Head of E2E Supply Planning.
   

  

**Your Impact Will Include**
* Develop and execute robust E2E supply plans to meet both commercial and clinical demand. Address imbalances by creating actionable options and assessing risks.
* Lead annual planning processes like Long Range Planning (LRP) and Safety Stock Assessments, ensuring accurate assumptions and scenario planning.
* Manage inventory levels and replenishment strategies to maintain service levels, reduce waste, and ensure delivery performance.
* Define, monitor, and act on key performance indicators, swiftly addressing deviations like Out-of-Stock situations with mitigation plans.
* Actively participate in the monthly Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process, delivering balanced and executable E2E plans.
* Oversee the lifecycle of supply for FG, DP, and DS, while continuously improving supply chain processes.
* Maintain accurate master data and ensure timely reporting of supply chain costs, transactions, and inventory reconciliation.


**Qualifications**
**About you**
 You are a dynamic and driven professional who thrives on solving complex challenges and making a real impact. With a sharp analytical mind and a strategic approach, you’re able to see the bigger picture while diving into the details when needed. You’re a natural collaborator, building strong relationships with stakeholders across functions and fostering trust and teamwork.
   

  

 In a fast-paced environment, you remain calm, focused, and adaptable, always ready to pivot when circumstances change. Your business-oriented mindset allows you to align supply chain strategies with organizational goals, while your passion for excellence drives you to continuously improve processes and outcomes. You bring energy, creativity, and a solutions-focused attitude to every challenge, making you a valued partner and leader in any team.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
* Proven experience in inventory and supply management, including planning, replenishment, and KPI monitoring.
* Strong understanding of E2E supply chain processes, including commercial and clinical demand planning.
* Expertise in scenario planning, risk assessment, and developing mitigation strategies.
* Familiarity with S&OP processes and global planning calendars.
* Proficiency in supply chain systems and tools, with a focus on maintaining data integrity.
* Fluent in and English and preferably Swedish.


 Here at Sobi we live by our core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership!
   

  

**Additional Information**
**How to apply**
 We have an ongoing selection process in this recruitment and ask you to send your application as soon as possible. Click apply and include your resume in English.
   

  

**Why Join Us?**
 Here At Sobi, Our Mission And Culture Get Us Excited To Come To Work Every Day, But Here Are a Few More Reasons To Join Our Team
   

  

* Emphasis on work/life balance
* Collaborative and team-oriented environment
* Opportunities for professional growth
* Diversity and Inclusion
* Competitive compensation for your work
* Making a positive impact to help ultra-rare disease patients who are in need of life saving treatments


 We are a global company with over 1,900 employees in more than 30 countries and are committed to the societies where we operate. With a deeply skilled management team directing our day-to-day wins, and a Board with a stellar track record, we’re ready to take on the world’s diseases, ailments and adversity. Our people believe they have the power to make a positive impact in others’ lives because that’s exactly what we do here. If you’re seeking a career that taps into your talents in a way that makes the world a better, healthier place, we just may have a job for you.
   

  

 We know our employees are our most valuable asset, and our culture conveys that. We offer a competitive benefits package, to support the health and happiness of our staff.
   

  

**Sobi Culture**
 At Sobi, we refuse to accept the status quo. This is because we have witnessed first-hand the challenges facing those affected by rare diseases and have used this knowledge to shape our business to find new ways of helping them.
   

  

 As a specialized biopharmaceutical company, we are dedicated to rare diseases. And we see this focus as a strength. By effectively turning our research into ground-breaking treatments, we help make medicine more accessible and open up more possibilities for patients and more opportunities for those caring for them. This has been our approach since day one, but we know we can’t change the world of rare diseases on our own. Accomplishing this requires strong partnerships with patients, partners and stakeholders across the entire value chain. Together, we define how our business can create solutions that serve the needs of those affected by rare diseases while facilitating sustainable growth.

title: IT-supporttekniker
description:
Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. Vi är specialister inom stadsutveckling, arkitektur och infrastruktur som bygger samhällen som håller.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som
 *IT-supporttekniker* 
 hos oss på Tyréns kommer du arbeta inom
 *Business Support & Business Development* 
 som består av totalt cirka 80 personer, specialiserade inom områdena IT, juridik, HR & lön, marknad & kommunikation, hållbarhet & kvalitet, säkerhet, fastighet & kontor samt strategi & projekt. Vi arbetar alla både strategiskt och operativt, med förvaltning och utveckling samt stöd och rådgivning med syftet att bidra till att förverkliga Tyréns affär:
 *Jobba med samhällsbyggnad med målet att skapa bättre förutsättningar för dagens och framtidens städer.*
*Digital Workplace* 
 är en del av Tyrénskoncernens IT-organisation. Avdelningen består av elva medarbetare som ansvarar för leveransen av den digitala arbetsplatsen med tillhörande service och support. Vår uppgift är att tillhandahålla en ändamålsenlig och fungerande datorermiljö, förvalta och utveckla telefonisystem och abonnemang för mobiltelefoner samt bemanna och tillgängliggöra servicedesk samt system och information för självhjälp inom IT-området.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du exempelvis jobba med att:
   

  

* Diagnostisera och lösa tekniska problem relaterade till hårdvara och mjukvara
* Aktivt arbeta i och bearbeta ärenden i ärendehanteringssystemet
* Installera, konfigurera och underhålla IT-utrustning, inklusive datorer, skrivare och kringutrustning
* Löpande bevaka och hantera medarbetarförändringar. Detta omfattar bland annat registerändringar, beställningar av utrustning såsom datorer, telefoner och telefonabonnemang
* Uppdatera dokumentation av tekniska procedurer, konfigurationer och supportlösningar


**Vi erbjuder**
 Som anställd på Tyréns erbjuder vi dig bland annat:
   

  

* Fantastiska kollegor och många specialister inom våra olika kompetensområden
* En värderingsdriven kultur där Connect, Create & Challenge är våra ledord
* En stimulerande arbetsmiljö i våra lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån del av din arbetstid
* Möjlighet att jobba med innovationsprojekt
* Kompetensutveckling anpassad efter dig
* Sociala aktiviteter, både på och efter ordinarie arbetstid
* Extra lediga dagar utöver dina semesterdagar, vi är t.ex. alltid lediga med lön dagarna mellan jul och nyår
* Flertalet personalförmåner via vår förmånsportal
* Kollektivavtal som vi tecknat med Innovationsföretagen (Almega)


 Klicka
 *här* 
 för att läsa mer om oss, vilken typ av projekt vi jobbar med, vilka utvecklingsmöjligheter som finns, våra innovationer, läsa bloggar och lyssna på våra medarbetares podcasts.
   

  

**Vi söker**
 För att lyckas och trivas i rollen bör du ha:
   

  

* Dokumenterad flerårig erfarenhet av en teknisk supportroll eller liknande IT-relaterad position
* Erfarenhet från 2-line eller 3-line support
* Gedigen kunskap om Active Directory, Microsoft Entra och Microsoft 365
* God kännedom och erfarenhet av klienthantering och applikationer i SCCM och Intune
* Kännedom om applikationer från Autodesk, Bentley, Microsoft, Adobe mfl.
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbete i DevOpsmiljö


 Meriterande är erfarenhet/kunskap inom:
   

  

* It-säkerhetsområdet
* Översiktliga kunskaper om hantering av applikationer i Citrix.
* Cad-applikationers licenshantering med hjälp av licensservrar och/eller molnbaserade licenssystem
* Dokumenterade kunskaper och certifieringar inom IT-området
* Liknande uppgifter inom samhällsbyggnadssektorn


 Personliga egenskaper vi tror passar rollen och vår företagskultur:
   

  

* Utmärkta problemlösnings- och analytiska färdigheter
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team i en dynamisk miljö
* Initiativförmåga


 För denna tjänst ser vi att du hanterar det svenska och engelska språket i både tal och skrift för att kunna tillmötesgå våra kunder och kollegors behov.
   

  

**Ansöka**
 Du är varmt välkommen med din ansökan! Personligt brev är inte ett krav hos oss, men kommer naturligtvis läsas om det bifogas.
   

  

 Vi rekryterar löpande, så skicka gärna din ansökan redan idag då tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Med hänvisning till GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar per mejl utan hanterar enbart ansökningar som kommer in via ansökningslänken.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Vill du veta mer om tjänsten eller har frågor? Då är du välkommen att kontakta:
   

  

 Anders Björkdahl
   

  

 Head of Digital workplace
   

  

 Mejl: Anders.Bjorkdahl@tyrens.se
   

  

 Telefon: 070-559 24 40
   

  

 Tyréns är ett av Sveriges ledande konsultföretag inom samhällsbyggnad. I samspel med kunder och partners skapar vi hållbara lösningar inom stadsutveckling och infrastruktur. Tyrénskoncernen har 3 000 medarbetare med verksamhet i Sverige, Storbritannien, Estland, Litauen, Polen, Bulgarien och Kanada. Tyréns är stiftelseägt och vår ägandeform gör det möjligt för oss att satsa målmedvetet på forskning och innovation inom samhällsbyggnadsområdet. Vi drivs av nyfikenhet och har ett nära samarbete med universitet och högskolor.
   

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

  

 Tillbaka
   

  

 Ansök

title: IT Security Specialist to Sweco IT
company_industry: Civil Engineering, Architecture and Planning, and Environmental Services
description:
*Do you want to be part of shaping a sustainable future through innovative technology? At Sweco IT, we’re looking for a driven and engaged IT security specialist to join our team. You’ll be contributing to digital capabilities to support Sweco’s mission of a sustainable transformation of society* 
*.*
 You will be part of a team that has a strong culture of helping each other, collaboration, and striving for improvements. The IT Security team is committed to ensuring that our IT systems are secure and that our employees have the necessary tools and knowledge to perform their work securely. We believe in sharing knowledge and supporting each other's growth and development. You will have the opportunity to work with experienced IT professionals who are dedicated to their work and committed to achieving the best results.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm.
   

  

**What We Are Looking For**
 In this role you will work closely with other IT teams to conduct security assessments and audits to identify vulnerabilities and assess risk levels. You will also work with other IT colleagues to ensure that all software and hardware are up to date with the latest security patches and updates. You will perform security assessments of cloud applications to visualise potential risks during application reviews.
   

  

**Other Responsibilities In The Role Includes**
* Assist in planning, implementing, and management of security measures to protect our IT infrastructure, networks, and systems from cyber-attacks, fraud, and other security breaches.
* Assist in developing and implement security policies and procedures and ensure that they are followed by all employees.
* Monitor and analyse security events and incidents and respond to security alerts and notifications.
* Stay up to date with the latest IT security trends, threats, and best practices.
* Respond to discovered incidents and work with resolving requests.


**About You**
 To be successful in the role as IT security specialist, we believe you have strong analytical and problem-solving skills. You have the ability to work both independently and as part of a team. You communicate in an efficient way at different levels and can explain complex security issues to non-technical stakeholders.
   

  

**Requirements**
* Proven experience with IT-Security, or equalling fields in IT, for a couple of years
* Good understanding of Microsoft Entra ID and Microsoft Azure IaaS
* Good knowledge about security software and tools, including firewalls, antivirus & EDR software, intrusion detection systems, and vulnerability scanners.
* Good knowledge in scripting e.g. PowerShell and Python


**Why join Sweco?**
* Professional development opportunities and various training opportunities.
* A pleasant and dynamic working atmosphere in a growing and leading company.
* An industry that is going through a major shift in way of working
* A culture that values inclusion, innovation, and continuous learning
* Flexible work with freedom and responsibility and a competitive compensation package.


**Can you see yourself as a part of Sweco?**
 Then don’t hesitate to send us your application and CV via the link below. We will review applications ongoing, so make sure you apply as soon as possible and no later than 20th of May.
   

  

 We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process, don’t hesitate to contact us. We will get back to all applicants after the recruitment process has been completed.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of shaping the future? Then we look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

**Contact Us**
 If you want to know more about the position or Sweco as a workplace, please contact Patrik Cederlöf, IT-Security Team Manager, at patrik.cederlof@sweco.se.
   

  

 Background checks will be carried out on the final candidate as part of this recruitment process.
   

  

*Sweco plans and designs the sustainable communities and cities of the future. Together with our customers, our 22,000 architects, engineers and other experts develop solutions to manage urbanization, take advantage of the opportunities of digitalization and make the societies of the future more sustainable. Sweco is the leading consulting company in technology and architecture in Europe with a turnover of approximately SEK 29 billion. The company is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For further information,* 
*http //www.sweco.se*

title: Account Cloud Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 As an Account Cloud Engineer, you’ll work with sales to bridge the gap between business and tech, inspiring customers with the value of Oracle Cloud. We are devoted to customer success and with a constantly evolving portfolio of cloud services we need architects that embrace change and can quickly determine how new services may be used in solutions that create value for our customers.
   

  

 What you will do
   

  

 Lead technical activity on customer accounts, from project concept to adoption. You’ll build a deep understanding of our customers’ systems, priorities, and business needs to find unique solutions.
   

  

* Become a trusted advisor on all things cloud engineering
* Provide technical expertise on cloud infrastructure, platforms, and architecture
* Ensure Oracle technology drives customer outcomes and sustainable growth
* Collaborate with sales to define account strategies and win new workloads
* Coordinate solution creation, architecture design, and workshops
* Demonstrate the value of our cloud products, architectures, and new technologies


 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 What we will offer
   

  

* A competitive salary with exciting benefits
* Flexible and remote working so you can do your best work
* Learning and development opportunities to advance your career
* An Employee Assistance Program to support your mental health
* Employee resource groups that champion our diverse communities
* Core benefits such as medical, life insurance, and access to retirement planning
* An inclusive culture that celebrates what makes you unique


 At Oracle, we don’t just respect differences—we celebrate them. We believe that innovation starts with inclusion and to create the future we need people with diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and abilities. That’s why we’re committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued that we’re inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/diversity-inclusion/
   

  

**Qualifications**
 Career Level - IC4
   

  

**About Us**
 As a world leader in cloud solutions, Oracle uses tomorrow’s technology to tackle today’s challenges. We’ve partnered with industry-leaders in almost every sector—and continue to thrive after 40+ years of change by operating with integrity.
   

  

 We know that true innovation starts when everyone is empowered to contribute. That’s why we’re committed to growing an inclusive workforce that promotes opportunities for all.
   

  

 Oracle careers open the door to global opportunities where work-life balance flourishes. We offer competitive benefits based on parity and consistency and support our people with flexible medical, life insurance, and retirement options. We also encourage employees to give back to their communities through our volunteer programs.
   

  

 We’re committed to including people with disabilities at all stages of the employment process. If you require accessibility assistance or accommodation for a disability at any point, let us know by emailing accommodation-request\_mb@oracle.com or by calling +1 888 404 2494 in the United States.
   

  

 Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans’ status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

title: Security Engineer
description:
**About Kustom** 




 Kustom, formerly known as Klarna Checkout (KCO), is the Nordic market leader in digital checkout solutions. Today, they support over 24,000 merchants across more than 170 countries, providing a streamlined checkout experience. They offer localized solutions in 18 markets, tailored to specific languages, currencies, and payment methods. No matter where businesses operate, they deliver a checkout experience that meets the needs of both merchants and shoppers - driving growth globally.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As Kustom’s Security Engineer you’ll be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the security infrastructure and systems to protect their company’s network, applications, and data from unauthorized access and threats. You’ll work closely with their product teams, providing expertise in both proactive and reactive security measures, as well as ensuring compliance with security standards and best practices.
 



  





**Among the things you'll be doing** 



* Design, implement, and manage security measures, including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention systems, and endpoint protection
* Monitor security systems for unusual activity, investigate incidents, and respond to security breaches in a timely and effective manner
* Manage vulnerability assessments, penetration testing, and risk analysis to identify potential weaknesses and mitigate risks
* Collaborate with product teams to design secure systems, applications, and networks with a focus on secure coding practices and threat modeling
* Lead the investigation of security incidents, root cause analysis, and assist in developing incident response plans and procedures
* Develop and conduct security training programs to enhance staff awareness and adherence to security policies
* Work closely with other technical teams (e.g., DevOps) to integrate security throughout the development and deployment processes
* Ensure compliance with relevant industry standards (e.g., NIST, ISO 27001, GDPR) and assist in audits and regulatory reporting



  





**About you** 



* You have a broad background from security engineering or related role with hands-on experience in securing enterprise networks and systems
* Proficiency with security tools (e.g., firewalls, IDS/IPS, SIEM systems, endpoint protection tools)
* Knowledge of encryption protocols, VPN technologies, and secure network design
* Experience with scripting and automation (e.g., Python, Bash, PowerShell)
* Familiarity with cloud security (AWS, Azure, GCP) and container security (Docker, Kubernetes)
* CISSP, CISM, CISA, CEH, or similar certifications preferred
* You have familiarity with standard security frameworks such as NIST, ISO 27001, SOC 2, and PCI-DSS



  





**To thrive in this role we believe you have** 



* Strong analytical skills and ability to troubleshoot complex security issues
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
* Ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment



  





**A place to grow** 




 At Kustom, you won’t just be another face in the crowd. This is a place where they elevate each other and celebrate success as a team. They believe in their ability to create excellence — and have fun doing it!
 



  





*Kustom is collaborating with Safemind for this recruitment.*

title: Tester
description:
Scania's R&D department is transforming to become part of TRATON Group R&D. TRATON is a group of strong brands with a shared mission: transforming transportation together to create the future of sustainable transport solutions. Within TRATON, we include MAN, Scania, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Together, we have the power to transform transportation.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are seeking a highly motivated and talented embedded system tester to join our team in the exciting field of steering actuators for trucks and buses. We are working both with cutting-edge technology on both not yet launched, as well as, launched steering systems.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 As a tester in our team you will have diverse tasks. Everything from writing test cases, reviewing test cases, testing on rigs, to testing in real trucks. You will be part of a diverse embedded systems development team and assist in daily development tasks such as requirement reviews and safety analyses. Your tasks will cover testing activities for our new systems that have not yet reached production as well as our legacy systems that we keep improving. Test methods will span from experimental manual testing to automized regression verification.
   

  

 Your main responsibilities include:
   

  

  

* Writing test cases by analysing requirements and other relevant sources.
* Participating in reviews of test cases and requirements.
* Execution of test cases in rigs and vehicles.
* Maintenance of rigs and development of new rigs.
* Writing automated tests in Python.
* Planning and following up on test activities.
* Writing test reports assessing quality, safety, and cyber security.


**Who you are?**
 We believe you have:
   

  

  

* A Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in systems Test and Verification. Preferably ISTQB certified.
* Experience with programming and modelling languages such as Python and MATLAB.
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* You have at least a B driver’s license (passenger car).
* Work experience in the automotive industry is an advantage.


*We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.*
**This Is Us**
 We are a team working with E/E systems connected to steering of trucks and busses. There are a lot of people to have technical discussions with. We are a mix of different personalities and experiences, with different backgrounds which makes us a complementary and diverse team. We work with both in-house developed steering systems, and steering systems developed by suppliers. We have products in different parts of the development cycle; both systems that has already been introduced on the market, and projects in the development phase. We have a passion for steering and we hope you want to be a part of our team!
   

  

 As a manager it is important to me to have an open climate where everyone can ask questions, and share their opinion, without anyone judging.
   

  

 Within TRATON Group R&D, you are an important part of something bigger. Joining us means gaining access to the ins and outs of the entire transportation industry. As part of a global team of industry experts, you get to think bigger, experience more, and reach further. Being bigger also means being stronger. Together with our brands, we have the collective power to transform transportation.
   

  

**We Offer**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, TRATON Group R&D supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, TRATON result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. We also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-29. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact:
   

  

 Annika Westad, Hiring Manager, annika.westad@scania.com

title: Automation Engineer
company_industry: Engineering Services and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Cleeven is an Engineering, R&D and IT consulting group enabling our clients support in their R&D efforts and operational excellence. We have know-hows in terms of innovation and R&D in a wide range of sectors: energy, services & banking, aerospace & defence, transportation, pharmaceuticals & chemicals, as well as IT & Telecoms.
 



  





 We are currently expanding our team and looking talented and passionate Automation Engineers to join our dynamic team. As a Automation Engineer, you will play a crucial role in crafting and implementing solutions across various projects and industries.
 



  





*Your responsibilities*

* Collaborating with engineers and stakeholders to understand project requirements
* Work closely with the team to ensure seamless integration of PLC solutions into the overall automation architecture
* Continuously researching and implementing best practices in Automation engineering



  





*Qualifications*

*Meritorious*
