title: Forensisk fotograf, NFC Malmö
description:
Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 Är du redo för en större uppgift?
   

  

 Nu söker vi Forensisk fotograf till NFC i Malmö.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till Polisens uppdrag – att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 Nationellt forensiskt centrum
   

  

 Nationellt forensiskt centrum är en avdelning inom Polismyndigheten. I nära samverkan med utredningsverksamheten leder, utvecklar och utför avdelningen forensiskt arbete för en framgångsrik brottsbekämpning. Avdelningen ansvarar för hela den forensiska processen inom polisen - från kriminaltekniska platsundersökningar, laborativ verksamhet och it-forensik till forensiska expertutlåtanden i brottmål. I uppdraget ingår också att agera expertstöd samt bedriva utbildning, strategisk forskning och utveckling för att framtidssäkra polisens forensiska förmåga.
   

  

 Laboratoriesektion Syd
   

  

 På laboratoriesektionerna i Syd, vid nationellt forensiskt centrum, genomförs forensiska undersökningar i syfte att ta fram, identifiera, jämföra och dokumentera spår från brottsplatser och tillvaratagna bevismaterial. Undersökningarna genomförs inom ämnesområdena fingeravtrycksframkallning, fingeravtrycksidentifiering, personidentifiering, dna-spårsäkring, skoavtryck, verktygsspår, forensisk fotografering och vapen. Verksamheten vid laboratoriesektionerna bedrivs i nära samverkan med de regionala forensiska sektionerna.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Fotografernas huvudsakliga uppgift är teknisk fotografering av spår och föremål i laboratoriet men också i fält. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår det även att genomföra visualiseringar av brottsplatser med hjälp av olika metoder utöver fotografering, som UAS (drönare), 360-dokumentation samt 3D-skanning. Arbetet sker i en omväxlande miljö och det är viktigt att kunna tempoväxla. Att både samarbeta i ett team och kunna fatta egna beslut hör till vardagen vilket kräver att man är ödmjuk inför uppgiften. För att bli forensisk fotograf genomgås en intern utbildning med handledning.
   

  

 Förekommande arbetsuppgifter:
   

  

* Teknisk fotografering i laboratorie- och studiomiljö.
* Avancerad fingeravtrycks, -och skoavtrycksfotografering.
* Fotografering med våglängdsberoende ljuskällor samt övriga specialfotograferingar.
* Föremålsfotografering i studio.
* Rekonstruktionsfilmning/ fotografering.
* Visualisering av brottsplats.
* Avancerad bildhantering samt film och ljudredigering.
* Filmning och ljudupptagning inom ärendeverksamheten och UAS (drönare).
* Presentation och utförande av 360-fotografering.


 Arbetsprov och test kan komma att utföras under rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 Krav
   

  

 Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:
   

  

* Minst 2-årig godkänd och avslutad högskoleutbildning inom fotografi alternativt motsvarande kunskaper förvärvade på annat sätt som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av fotografering i närtid.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med redigering av rörlig bild och ljud i närtid.
* Mycket god kunskap och kännedom om den tekniska utrustningen du använder i din roll som fotograf.
* Goda kunskaper i bildredigering med Photoshop, Bridge/ Lightroom eller liknande programvara.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift.
* God kunskap i engelska, både i tal och skrift.
* Fullgott färg-, siffer-, bokstavs- och detaljséende.
* B-körkort.


 Meriterande kunskaper
   

  

 Vi ser det som meriterande om du utöver ovan även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet inom forensisk fotografering.
* Utbildning och/eller erfarenhet av kriminaltekniska metoder.
* Erfarenhet med fotografering med forensiska ljuskällor.
* Erfarenhet av ISO-certifierat kvalitetsarbete.
* Erfarenhet av att dokumentera och redovisa resultat skriftligt och muntligt, vid myndighet eller liknande organisation.


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

 Arbetet som forensisk fotograf är en viktig del i rättskedjan. Då arbetet är såväl strukturerat och rutinbetonat, som oförutsägbart ser vi att du är flexibel i ditt förhållningssätt samt har god förmåga att prioritera. Det är helt avgörande att du är en person som känner stort ansvar inför dina arbetsuppgifter, arbetar med stor noggrannhet och kan leverera ett resultat som håller hög kvalitet, oavsett om arbetsuppgiften är enkel och rutinbetonad eller komplex och utmanande. Vi arbetar i en grupp som är beroende av att alla bidrar till gruppens gemensamma mål och varvar samarbete med självständigt arbete. För att växa hos oss ser vi att du är öppen för återkoppling och nya perspektiv samt att du trivs med att ständigt lära nytt och utvecklas.
   

  

 Vi kommer lägga mycket stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Christian Bondegaard-Lautrup , Rekryterande chef
   

  

 0724569254
   

  

 christian.bondegaard-lautrup@polisen.se
   

  

 Silvia Toth , HR-konsult
   

  

 silvia.toth@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet: Sofia Ask, tfn 010-563 87 10 SACO: Fanny Carlström Plaza, tfn 010-562 84 46 SEKO Polisen: Karna Tillheden, tfn 073-249 04 22, ST: st.region-syd@polisen.se
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Arbetsort: Malmö
   

  

 Arbetstid: Heltid, Veckoplanerad arbetstid 5:2
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Forensisk fotograf
   

  

 Anställningsbenämning: Handläggare
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 Vi använder e-rekrytering för att effektivisera och kvalitetssäkra rekryteringsarbetet. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via Polisens rekryteringsstöd Visma Recruit.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 Om du vill komplettera din ansökan vänder du dig till ansvarig HR-konsult.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet. Vi erbjuder dig en arbetsplats som stimulerar till mångfald, kreativitet och personlig utveckling.
   

  

 Läs gärna om våra förmåner som anställd hos polisen på: polisen.se/erbjudande
   

  

 Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen.
   

  

 Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 polisen.se
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Vi undanber oss samtal och mail från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Sök jobbet
   

  

 Ansökan sker via polisens rekryteringsverktyg

title: Lärare i Ma/SV särskild undervisningsgrupp till Samskolan, Nacka kommun
description:
Har du ett genuint intresse av att ge elever bästa förutsättningar att nå sina mål? Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens skola samt kombinera undervisning med deltagande i spännande forskningsprojekt? Då är Samskolan i Saltsjöbaden rätt val för dig!
   

  

 Saltsjöbadens samskola driver en framgångsrik verksamhet och undervisning med stort fokus på att alla våra elever ska lyckas. Vi arbetar utifrån en pedagogisk modell med varierad undervisning, tydlighet kring mål och bedömning, samt förtroendefulla relationer mellan vuxna och elever.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en trygg, professionell och engagerad lärare i matematik och svenska som vill vara mentor, samordna och undervisa i en liten undervisningsgrupp på högstadiet.
   

  

 Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på ett år med start i augusti med eventuell möjlighet till förlängning.
   

  

**Ditt uppdrag**
 I ditt uppdrag som lärare i den särskilda undervisningsgruppen undervisar du i matematik, svenska och vid behov engelska, och samverkar nära elevhälsoteamet, specialpedagoger och ämneslärare för att stötta elever med särskilda behov. Rollen är relativt ny för skolan vilket ger dig möjlighet att påverka verksamheten tillsammans med specialpedagogerna och ansvarig biträdande rektor.
   

  

 Tjänsten består av två delar med huvudfokus på undervisning och samordning av särskild undervisningsgrupp. Du är mentor för en liten klass med elever som har den särskilda undervisningsgruppen som hemvist och har tät kontakt med klassmentor för övriga elever i gruppen. Du ansvarar för planering, genomförande och utvärdering av undervisningen utifrån läroplan och skollagen.
   

  

 Vidare stöttar du till viss del vår specialpedagog med stödinsats till elever i behov av särskilt stöd i årskurs 8 och 9. Stödet sker i lärandesituationer och kan vara enskilt, i mindre grupp eller i klassrummet, beroende på dina erfarenheter.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 För denna tjänst krävs att du har:
   

  

* specialpedagogisk kompetens
* undervisat i skola eller motsvarande.


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* arbetat på en resursskola, särskild undervisningsgrupp eller liknande som arbetsgivaren bedömer relevant
* lärarlegitimation
* ämnesbehörighet i matematik och svenska eller engelska
* ämnesbehörighet för åk 4-6 eller 7-9.


 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi söker dig med god ämneskunskap, didaktisk skicklighet och relationell förmåga. Med ett tydligt ledarskap har du möjlighet att göra skillnad för elever utifrån deras individuella förutsättningar. Du är initiativtagande, flexibel och självgående. Andra viktiga egenskaper är gott omdöme, noggrannhet och god samarbetsförmåga. Förmågan att skapa och bibehålla relationer med elever, vårdnadshavare, kollegor och andra kontaktytor är avgörande. Därutöver krävs förmåga att vara strukturerad för att planera verksamheten på kort och lång sikt.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Saltsjöbadens samskola erbjuder elever från F-9 ett lärande med hög kvalitet i en trivsam och trygg skolmiljö. Skolan är beläget i ett naturskönt och lugnt område nära hav och skog. Vi har tillgång till ishall, tennishall, idrottshallar, fotbollsplan, moderna IT-verktyg och specialsalar. Vår internationella inriktning med 20 procent undervisning på engelska är mycket populär bland eleverna i årskurs 4-9. På vår skola får du arbeta med professionella och trevliga kolleger där alla hjälps åt. Läs mer om oss här.
   

  

 Vi har byggt upp en Lärarakademi med syfte att driva och skapa nätverk för forskande skolor och lärare inom både närområde och internationellt. Vi har ett nära samarbete med Luleå Tekniska Universitet och bl.a. startar vi tillsammans en lärarutbildning till hösten. Hos oss har du möjlighet att driva olika spännande forskningsprojekt och utvecklingsuppdrag. Du får delta på forskningskonferenser samt har du utbyte med internationella kontakter.
   

  

 Som anställd i Nacka kommun har du bland annat tillgång till förmåner som friskvårdsbidrag på 3 000 kr per år, köp av SL-kort via nettolöneavdrag och en mångsidig intern stödfunktion. I Nacka får du möjlighet att arbeta i en kommun som vill vara bäst i Sverige på att vara kommun, och som har öppenhet och mångfald som sin vision och en grundläggande värdering att lita på människors kunskap, vilja och förmåga.
   

  

**Intresserad?**
 Om du vill bli en del av Nacka kommun, tveka inte att skicka in din ansökan! Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta biträdande rektor Maria Trygger på 0704313056 och maria.trygger@nacka.se.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer kan komma att ske löpande under ansökningstiden. Tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag. Vi tar endast emot ansökningar via vårt rekryteringssystem. Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan!
   

  

 I rekryteringen har vi valt att rekrytera utan personligt brev. Vid bedömningen av din ansökan utgår vi endast ifrån ditt CV och ett antal frågor som du får besvara i samband med din ansökan.
   

  

**Utdrag ur Polisens belastningsregister för skola och förskola krävs** 
 i samband med anställning. Vi ber dig att välja "digitalt registerutdrag" för snabbare hantering. Länk här.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll kan komma att tillämpas.
   

  

 Tjänsten tillsätts under förutsättning att den inte behöver tas i anspråk för intern omplacering.
   

  

 Besök gärna Nackas kommunala skolor och förskolors karriärsida här
   

  

 Nacka är en av Sveriges mest attraktiva och välrenommerade kommuner. Med fokus på mål, resultat, hållbart medarbetarengagemang och ständig utveckling strävar Nacka efter att bli bäst på att vara kommun. Nacka kommun är arbetsgivaren för dig som med stor frihet förnyar och gör skillnad.
   

  

 Saltsjöbadens samskola erbjuder elever från F-9 ett lärande med hög kvalitet i en trivsam och trygg skolmiljö. Våra elever har tillgång till idrottshallar, ishall, fotbollsplan, moderna IT-verktyg och specialsalar för biologi, fysik, kemi, bild, musik, slöjd samt hem- och konsumentkunskap. Vår internationella inriktning med 20 procent undervisning på engelska är mycket populär bland eleverna i årskurs 4-9. Fritidsverksamheten för F-6 är integrerad i skolan och samverkar kring barnens lärande. Vi bygger upp en egen lärarakademi och våra lärare genomför forskningsprojekt i klassrummet i samarbete med Luleå Tekniska Universitet. Nu söker vi dig som vill bidra och hänge dig åt vårt fortsatta arbete med att skapa framtidens skola där våra barn och ungdomar ska växa med kunskaper för livet i en föränderlig värld!
   

  

 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Nacka | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/308 | Kontakt: Maria Trygger +46859845717, | Facklig företrädare: Sveriges lärare, Mikael Eriksson mikael.eriksson@nacka.se, | Publicerat: 2025-05-12 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-29

title: People Partner Nordic P&C, (1-year parental leave)
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
**About Us** 




 Valtech is the experience innovation company, combining the uncommon to unlock a better way for people to experience the world. We work at the intersection of diverse disciplines, cultures and perspectives to create solutions that achieve the exceptional – helping brands make the leap beyond the competition and become leaders in a digital world.
 



 Our clients trust Valtech to remove complexity and deliver innovative, frictionless solutions that close the experience gap between customer expectation and reality. We are a network of more than 6,500 makers, strategic thinkers, marketers, creatives, and deep-tech engineers and data + AI specialists spanning 5 continents with 60+ offices in 20+ countries.
 



  





**About The Role** 




 Valtech is looking for a People Partner, Nordic P&C to cover for a 1-year parental leave. We are based in central Stockholm, right next to the city hall and offer a hybrid way of working.
 



 As a People Partner, you will play a crucial role in aligning our people strategy with business objectives. You will partner with leaders to foster a positive workplace culture, drive employee engagement, and support talent development across the Nordic region. The People Partner is also expected to support general admin and selected areas within People & Culture operations.
 



 We’re looking for a People Partner with a few years of relevant experience and education. However, there's also room to grow in the role, and we’ll place strong emphasis on your communication and collaboration skills.
 



 We have a set start date for this position and would like you to start in August 2025.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* You will act as a trusted advisor to people managers, providing guidance on employee relations and P&C policies.
* Oversee HR administrative tasks, maintain employee personnel records and ensuring accurate record-keeping and compliance with policies.
* Provide policy and procedure guidance to employees and management as well as responding to human resources-related inquiries.
* Prepare paperwork and schedules for smooth new-hire onboarding process, coordinating with cross-functional departments to deliver an exceptional first-day experience.
* Conduct exit interviews and recommend corrective action if necessary.
* Admin leave of absences and guide employees and managers on rules and policies.
* Manage HRIS and reporting.
* Submits accurate governmental compliance survey data on a regular basis.
* Represents P&C in community and company events.



  





**What You Can Expect From Us** 




 Valtech will always be recognized not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop.
 



 Read more about life at Valtech here.
 



 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.
 



  





**Join Valtech** 




 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.
 



 Does it excite you to join Valtech on this journey?
 



 Then apply today. We are looking forward to your application!

title: DevOps Engineer
description:
We are looking for a skilled DevOps Engineer with an enthusiastic mindset to join our Infrastructure and Security team. This team is the heart of Kivra and is building and supporting a large, scalable platform for all our services. The platform provides distributed systems that handle all our data with great reliability and security.


### **What you'll do**


You'll play a key role in Kivras Infrastructure team, where you will work alongside great colleagues with automation of deployment pipelines, monitoring and alerting and regular system and network management among other things. You will develop and drive implementation of new tools in order to make our infrastructure more efficient as well as maintain and improve our current infrastructure. And always with a focus on the security and stability of our services!


Our infrastructure is based on:

* Distributed systems, micro service architecture (Docker and Kubernetes)
* Automation and provisioning with Ansible and Terraform
* Colocation and Google Cloud Platform using Ubuntu/CentOS
* Web stack: HAProxy, Google LB, Istio, cillium
* Monitoring and logging: Zabbix, Sentry, Pagerduty, Splunk
* Zookeeper, Kafka, Python, Erlang and some Java backend applications
* Self hosted hardware: HP, Supermicro, Cisco
* Database environment: Riak, PostgreSQL
* IAM: Google & MS AD

### **Required skills**


Who you are and how you fit the team is super important. We thrive on being nice and helpful to each other and to the rest of the company!


But to have fun at Kivra you also need to have strong skills in Linux, Enterprise level IT system management and automation (e.g. Ansible/Terraform) paired with an equally strong sense of service. You have worked with DevOps and SRE for some years now and are therefore well versed in working in hybrid environments spanning from on prem to the cloud. And, to quote ourselves, “always with a focus on the security and stability of our services''

### **Desired skills**


If you know network and firewall management that is really great. Database management is a huge plus as well as knowledge of web application management. And last but not least, a solid understanding of containers and container orchestration would make you an even stronger candidate.


The role also gives you the opportunity to specialize within one or several fields. We are looking for someone with a strong skill set and past experience within our tech stack. We have a very warm and friendly culture and we expect you to take part in that naturally. We thrive on collaboration and teamwork, we expect personal initiatives and love strong opinions based on facts.

**We offer**


Kivra offers a place in a committed team with the opportunity for a high degree of innovation. You will be involved in influencing Kivra's exciting business and product development of a service that is currently used by more than half of Sweden's population. One of Kivra's values is happy-happy, which is also reflected in the concern for Kivra's staff. In addition to collective agreements and wellness, we offer a number of other great benefits.

**How to apply**


Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Andreas Nilsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at andreas.nilsson@kivra.com.

title: Seniorutvecklare C#/C++
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Du kommer att bidra i hela utvecklingskedjan, från kravanalys till implementation och test, i nära samarbete med övriga teammedlemmar.  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Civilingenjör eller högskoleingenjör inom data/elektronik eller motsvarande
* Gedigen erfarenhet av programmering i C# och C/C++
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla verktygsapplikationer, emulatorer
* God förståelse för och erfarenhet av MVVM-designmönstret
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift

  

**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av versionshantering med GIT och arbete enligt DevOps-principer
* Erfarenhet av IAR Embedded Workbench och/eller Eclipse
* Tidigare arbete med fordonssystem eller inbyggda system

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 23-05-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Solutions Architect Enterprise, AWS Sweden
description:
- Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
- Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
- Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
- Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
- English business level communication skills written and verbal
  

Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
Come build the future with us.
AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
About the team
The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will have the support to grow your expertise. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At AWS you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
Diverse Experiences
AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
Why AWS?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
Inclusive Team Culture
AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
Mentorship & Career Growth
We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
Work/Life Balance
We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
  

* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content

  

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.  

  

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
company_description: Amazon Web Services (AWS) offers the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform, with over 200 powerful services that enable our customers and our people to make more of an impact.

title: Scaled Customer Success Manager
description:
**Join us to scale customer impact and shape the future of work at Simployer!**



At Simployer, we are dedicated to simplifying work-life for our clients by delivering innovative solutions that enhance their everyday business operations. We are currently seeking a dynamic and experienced Scaled Customer Success Manager to join our team and help us drive our mission forward.


**What We Offer**


* **Collaborative Culture** – Join a supportive, dynamic team dedicated to learning and growth.
* **Professional Development** – Access opportunities to expand your skills and grow within the organization.
* **Competitive Compensation** – Enjoy a market-aligned salary and benefits package.
* **Real Impact** – Make a significant impact on our products, clients, and business.


**About the Role**



We’re expanding our Nordic Customer Success team and looking for a Customer Success Manager who is passionate about creating value at scale. This isn’t just about managing customers. It’s about shaping how we serve and support a rapidly growing customer base in smarter, more scalable ways. By joining us, you’ll play a vital role in building the very foundation for what Customer Success means in the digital era - not just at Simployer, but across the HR tech landscape.



You’ll be joining a strong and ambitious team in Sweden, working side-by-side with expert CSMs, Revenue Operations, Customer Marketing, Product, and our Care team. Your focus? Our Expert Help customers - a large and diverse segment - where you’ll lead initiatives that improve adoption, drive retention, and create measurable impact across the full customer lifecycle.



This role is key to our long-term strategy: What you create here will influence not just your customers, but the success model for our entire CS organization.


**Work with great people**
--------------------------


**Thomas Ellingsen**
Senior DevOps


"I really enjoy my job because I work with a talented and supportive team. In my work I’m able to make mistakes and learn from them. This encourages me to take risks and continuously improve my skills."
**Karoline Brynildsen**
Engineering Manager


"I started in Simployer as a developer before transitioning in to team lead and later engineering manager. Working here for almost 10 years I have had the opportunity to continuously grow and develop."
**Maria Dahlqvist**
Senior Customer Consultant


"In my work I help our customers to find the best way to use our products and how to simplify their processes. Sharing our experiences help us to develop ourselves, our customers and products."
**Sally Russel**
Head of Product Marketing


"The best thing about Simployer? The people. Smart, kind, and always up for a challenge. We push each other to grow and have fun while doing it."
**Michał Sekuła**
Engineering Manager


"In Simployer amazing things are delivered by amazing people. With our culture where we take care of each other we are able to grow individually and as a company and go beyond any limitations."
**Ida Ljungberg**
Legal Adviser HR & Management


"Our HR Services would have been very useful for me in my previous HR jobs. So contributing to our customers within labour law, HR and payroll is one of the reasons why I really enjoy working here!"
Skills & Requirements


**What You Will Do:**


* Run strategic, one-to-many engagement programs such as webinars, lifecycle campaigns, and digital content.
* Own the full customer journey - onboarding, adoption, renewal - for a large and varied customer base.
* Monitor customer health and proactively address churn signals using data tools like Planhat and Power BI.
* Collaborate across Product, Marketing, Customer Care and Expert Advisors to align strategy and insights.
* Continuously improve automation and digital touchpoints to enhance the customer experience.
* Contribute to define and shape a high-performing, scalable Customer Success model that will grow with Simployer.
* Work closely with other Scaled CSMs as part of a strong and ambitious Nordic CS team and drive consistency and innovation across markets.


**What You Will Bring to the Team:**


* A background in Customer Success, Account Management, or digital customer engagement.
* A data-driven mindset and strong analytical skills - you're not afraid to dive deep into dashboards.
* Experience managing large portfolios using automation and digital tools.
* Experience using tools like Planhat, Salesforce, and Power BI, or the ability to learn them quickly.
* A proactive, structured, and collaborative approach - you're motivated by ownership and forward momentum.
* Collaborative team player with the ability to see the big picture.
* Excellent communication skills in Swedish, and English (written and verbal).


**It's a Plus if You Also Bring:**

* Experience in B2C or personalized digital communication at scale
* Familiarity with A/B testing, chatbots, or self-service channels
* A Master’s degree or certifications in digital strategy, analytics or customer success


**Message from the Hiring Manager:**

*Hi, I’m so glad you’re here. I’m Isabel, and I lead the Customer Success team in Sweden.*


*At Simployer, we’re passionate about helping our customers succeed with smart solutions that truly make a difference. Just as important to me is creating a space where you feel supported. You’ll have the coaching and freedom you need to grow—and a team that values psychological safety, trust, and care.*


*I’m really looking forward to working with you!*



— Isabel Dahlin, Head of Customer Success Sweden



**Why Join Simployer?**



By joining Simployer, you’ll be part of a dynamic, inclusive, and innovative workplace. You’ll have access to unlimited resources and extensive industry experience while working with a variety of exciting products. We’re building something big — join us and be part of a culture that values your growth and success. Together, we’ll change the HR tech game!


**Our Hiring Process:**


* **Intro Chat:** A quick conversation with our recruiter to get to know you and for you to learn about us and the role (approx. 30 minutes).
* **Logic test and Personality test (Alva Labs)** – Discover how you’ll fit with our team.
* **Meet & Greet:** Meet with your future manager to dive deeper into your experience and discuss the role (approx. 1 hour)
* **Case interview:** Show us your skills through real-world problem-solving. (approx. 1 hour)
* **Team Chat:** A casual chat to wrap things up, answer any last questions, and make sure we’re a perfect match (approx. 30 minutes).



We can’t wait to meet you!



At Simployer, we believe in empowering our employees to achieve their best. Join us and contribute to a workplace where your skills and ideas can truly make a difference.


**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------


Hybrid and flexible work model


Modern offices


Pension and health care


Laughs, develops, and celebrates together


HR tech company


Career opportunities


Simployer is a “people first” company. We offer a unique combination of high-value and people-centric products, services and expertise. Our simplifying solutions are the preferred choice of more than 15,000 customers and 1,2 million users in Northern Europe. For almost four decades, we have helped our customers unleash the full potential in people, the core asset of any company. Managers who want to lead better – by inspiring, engaging and developing their employees – choose our solutions. We are on an exciting journey where we will continue to grow our company into new markets in Northern Europe. In Simployer we have a culture where it is possible to grow, and to have a direct impact on the business through empowerment and flat structure. You will work with colleagues who are passionate about their work and we can promise you that we have a lot of fun at work. To succeed in the market, reach our growth goals and continue to fulfil our vision, we need top talent who shares our conviction that people make businesses grow. Are you our next Simployee?  



  

**Our Values**
**Learn, Lead and Deliver**
With every new piece of information we acquire, and every new skill we develop, we become stronger, wiser, and more capable of delivering good products and meaningful experiences. We will never stop seeking knowledge, for it is the key that unlocks the door to our greatest potential.
We are open to new ideas and perspectives, eager to make the next move. We are curious about way of working and stay ahead of the curve. We lead by example and dare to fail fast. We're on a fun journey, as a team and together with our customer.
We put passion and dedication into our work, because we know that every delivery is an opportunity to make a difference. We approach each task with our hearts and a drive to exceed expectations. We don't just deliver, we do it with a passion for both our customer and Simployees.
We embrace what makes us human, take time to play and have fun together.
  
Hilda Westin | Contact Person

title: DevOps Engineer SW build system
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We at Ericsson Packet Core (PC) in Lindholmen are now looking for a talented DevOps Engineer for our Software Build System team.

  

You will work to lead, guide, and support our experienced Design Environment teams in our Engineering Environment organization, while interfacing with our stakeholders and guarding/maintaining a stable Environment structure and strategy.

  

Our Design Environment teams consist of a diverse group of developers with a broad understanding of our design environment and strategy. We work according to Agile principles with close collaboration with our Operational Product Owners.

 **What you will do:**

  

In this role you will work to design, maintain and support our product development environment with a focus on both build systems and functional test.


This is an opportunity to drive the continuous improvement of our environments, tools and processes.

  

Your task will include development activities in our build system such as software design, build system design, integration, verification, simulations, tools design, Product Lifecycle Management support as well as product documentation.  

  

You will also perform advanced troubleshooting and help to develop competence in the technical domain. We organise our development teams with continuous improvement, innovation and knowledge sharing as an integral part of the daily work.

 **The skills you bring:**

* You enjoy collaboration with others and are yourself a team player
* You have experience with scrum or similar methodologies
* You value sharing your knowledge and don't hesitate to ask when you need to learn about something.
* You can “pick up” new concepts and contribute “going the extra mile” when needed.
* You have a service-oriented mindset.
* You thrive with solving problems, seeing them as opportunities.
* You can prioritize and make decisions whenever needed.
* Proficient in Python scripting
* A command of Linux, working with high performance Linux applications
* Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment
* Good communication skills, individual and group level
* Experience with Development, integration, deployment and orchestration technologies (such as Git/Gerrit, Jenkins, Docker, Kubernetes).
* Experience with SCM tools & processes.
* Experience with Maintaining Internet-facing production-grade applications in virtualized environments such as cloud computing platforms and services.
* Experience with using and maintaining IDEs (such as Eclipse and VSCode).

 **Meriting**:

  

* Domain experience in 3GPP Mobility area
* Earlier experience of working in the Software Configuration Management Domain
* Experience in managing Functional Test environments at scale
* In addition to this, we value domain experience from working with tools development, Continuous Integration, build systems and Automation.
* We believe you are familiar with standard IT security practices such as encryption, certificates and key management.
* Any experience in developing software in PDU Packet Core or understanding the development flow of PC products is also considered a merit.
**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Göteborg

**Req ID:** 759125

description:

title: Cyber Defence Analyst
description:
**Job Description**
 Working in the H&M Cyber Defence Centre, you will work with world class tooling for threat hunting, detection and response based on cloud technology (e.g. Azure Sentinel, Defender for Endpoint, Defender for O365, GCP SCC, Akamai, and more) with a dedicated team of DevOps engineers constantly develop tooling to support analysis, response and automations.
   

  

 Our Cyber Defense Centre is the beating heart in the defence of our company, combining intelligence, monitoring, incident response and threat hunting with an engineering mindset to make the most out of people and technology.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 As a
 **Cyber Defence Analyst** 
 in our Cyber Defense Centre team, you play a key role in H&M Group’s Cyber Defence. You understand cyber security threats and the threat landscape. You will act to detect, analyse and respond to cyber-attacks, manage incidents and reduce risk to customers, colleagues, partners and the company. You will work with the team to improve the capabilities to reduce response time but at the same time maintain quality. We are taking advantage of the latest technology in intelligence and automation. Ultimately the aim is to bring value to our business by reducing risk!
   

  

 In this role you will be
 **responsible** 
 for:
   

  

* Analyse security incidents, alerts, and events.
* Investigate incidents according to SOP: s and best practice.
* Perform remediation activities according to SOP: s and best practices.
* Interaction with key stakeholders to support investigation and remediation.
* Escalation and investigation of major incidents according to SOP:s
* Support major and crisis incident response activities.
* Improve and develop detection, whitelisting, SOP:s, and automation for incident and alert handling.
* Optimize security tools to improve monitoring and defence capabilities, including cloud security solutions.
* Conduct vulnerability assessments and collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement remediations.


**Qualifications**
**WHO YOU ARE**
* Understanding of cloud security principles and architectures across various platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, or private cloud environments).
* Proficiency in cloud-native security tools for monitoring, threat detection, and incident response.
* Proficiency in Identity and Access Management (IAM), virtualized network security, and cloud compliance standards.
* Proven experience in monitoring, analysing and responding to security incidents.
* Experience with developing custom detection in either SIEM, XDR, EDR, or NDR solutions and understands the logic behind it.
* Good understanding of networking concepts (e.g., TCP/IP, DNS, VPNs) and protocols, knowledge in packet capture analysis tools (e.g., Wireshark, TCPdump), and intrusion detection techniques.
* 2-4 years of relevant experience in roles such as SOC analyst, CSIRT member, or similar cybersecurity positions.
* Ability to work independently on incident response and collaborate effectively with other teams.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to ensure chain-of-custody protocols and report findings in a clear, detailed manner.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: DevOps Kubernetes
description:
Beskrivning av tjänsten
   

  

 Vår konsultorganisation behöver förstärka med fler duktiga DevOps-tekniker som är redo att ta sig an uppdrag för våra kunder.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill följa med på en spännande resa framåt och få möjligheten att växa med ett globalt företag som är marknadsledande inom den svenska IT-marknaden. Hos oss får du arbeta i spännande projekt och uppdrag, vi utlovar inspirerande arbetsuppgifter och utveckling.
   

  

 Du kommer vara en del av en konsultgrupp med olika specialiteter för att kunna ge våra kunder den bästa leveransen och bred service. Du kommer att få delta i spännande och stimulerande samarbeten med kollegor på CGI och medarbetare hos våra kunder.
   

  

 Dina framtida arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du som konsult för våra kunder som behöver din expertis inom DevOps Våra kunder är stora företag eller organisationer inom offentlig sekor. Arbetsuppgifterna är varierande, men sträcker sig från nyutveckling till förvaltning. Du förväntas arbeta både hands-on och praktiskt, men även med analys, planering och strategi.
   

  

 Arbetet kan utföras hos kund, på något av CGI´s kontor i Stockholm eller på distans från hemmet, det beror på kundens önskemål och krav. De flesta av våra konsulter har en hybridlösning, där man varierar.
   

  

 Kvalifikationer för att bli framgångsrik denna roll
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen söker vi dig som har en vilja att utvecklas och ta till dig nya kunskaper. Du ser möjligheter till lösningar hellre än problem. Vi ser gärna att du tycker om att samarbeta och att dela med dig av dina kunskaper men att du även har ett driv att själv utvecklas och växa både som individ och tillsammans med andra. Som konsult är det viktigt att man är flexibel och inte rädd för att möta och samarbeta med nya personer.
   

  

 Erfarenhet och kunskap
   

  

* Du har erfarenhet av DevOps antingen genom dina eftergymnasiala IT-utbildning alternativt har du förskaffat dig erfarenheten genom din arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Kubernetes och Docker
* AWS, Azure eller Google Cloud Plattform
* Linux
* CI/CD


 Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper där vi gärna ser att du är nyfiken, engagerad och har en kreativ problemlösningsförmåga, en positiv inställning samt trivs med att arbeta med stort kundfokus. Du behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande, både i tal och skrift
   

  

 Vill du veta mer?
   

  

 Har du frågor om jobbet kontakta rekryterande ledare Marcus Gridange, marcus.grindange@cgi.com. Vi tillämpar löpande urval skicka därför in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Som anställd erbjuds du nedan förmåner:
   

  

* Föräldralön: Vi betalar upp till cirka 90% av din lön under den första tiden hemma.
* Aktieprogram och delägarskap: Som delägare har du möjlighet att påverka och i vårt aktieprogram matchar CGI ditt bidrag, krona för krona upp till 3% av din månadslön.
* Friskvårdsbidrag: Vi erbjuder ett årligt friskvårdsbidrag på 4 000 kr.
* Trygg anställning: Våra medlemmar anställs med kollektivavtal och försäkringar.
* Pensionslösningar: Vi erbjuder attraktiva och förmånliga pensionslösningar.
* Personalbil: Personalbilen används som en privatbil men leasas av CGI.


 Övrigt
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroller och registerkontroll kan komma att genomföras om uppdraget kräver det.
   

  

 Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.
   

  

 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.
   

  

**Låt oss som ägare omvandla verklig insikt till handling – tillsammans.**
 Livet på CGI bygger på ägande, lagarbete, respekt och tillhörighet. Tillsammans med oss kommer du att kunna nå din fulla potential.
   

  

 Du är inbjuden att ta ägandeskap redan från första dagen i vårt arbete med att förverkliga vår dröm om att skapa en arbetsmiljö där vi trivs med att arbeta tillsammans och bidrar till framgången för vårt företag. Det är därför vi kallar oss CGI Partners snarare än anställda. Vi drar nytta av vår kollektiva framgång och tillsammans får vi möjlighet att aktivt forma vår företagsstrategi och inriktning.
   

  

 Ditt arbete skapar värde. Du kommer att vara med att utveckla innovativa lösningar och bygga relationer med medarbetare och kunder samtidigt som du får tillgång till globala möjligheter att skala upp dina idéer, omfamna nya möjligheter och dra nytta av gedigen bransch- och teknikexpertis.
   

  

 Du kommer att forma din karriär tillsammans med ett företag som är byggt för att växa och bestå. Du får stöd av ledare som bryr sig om din hälsa och ditt välbefinnande och ger dig möjligheter att fördjupa dina kunskaper och vidga dina vyer.
   

  

 Bli en del en av världens största leverantörer av IT- och affärskonsulttjänster.

title: Cyber Defence Analyst – eCom
description:
**Job Description**
 Working in the H&M Cyber Defense Center eCom, you will work with world class tooling for threat hunting, detection and response based on cloud technology (For example, Azure Sentinel, Defender for Endpoint, Defender for O365, GCP SCC, Akamai, and more) with a dedicated team of DevOps engineers constantly develop tooling to support analysis, response and automations.
   

  

 Our Cyber Defense Center is the beating heart in the defense of our company, combining intelligence, monitoring, incident response and threat hunting with an engineering mindset to make the most out of people and technology.
   

  

 As a
 **Cyber Security Analyst** 
 in our Cyber Defense Center
 **eCom** 
 team, you play a key role in H&M Group’s Cyber Defense. You understand cyber security threats and the threat landscape. You will act to detect, analyze and respond to cyber-attacks, manage incidents and reduce risk to customers, colleagues, partners and the company. You will work with the team to improve the capabilities to reduce response time but at the same time maintain quality. We are taking advantage of the latest technology in intelligence and automation. Ultimately the aim is to bring value to our business by reducing risk!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 In this role you will be responsible for:
   

  

* Analyze security incidents, alerts, and events .
* Investigate incidents according to SOP: s and best practice .
* Perform remediation activities according to SOP: s and best practice.
* Interaction with stakeholders to support investigation and remediation .
* Escalation of major incidents according to SOP: s
* Support major incident response activities.
* Improve and develop detection, whitelisting, SOP:s, and automation for incident and alert handling.


**Qualifications**
* Can explain the principles of threat intelligence, modelling and assessment.
* Can explain the principles of a computer system, network and storage security architecture and how these can be used to reduce information risk
* Have experience with operating as a member of an CSIRT or SOC.
* Have experience with Incident management, investigation and response.
* Have experience with developing custom detection in either Bot Management, SIEM or EDR solutions and understands the logic behind it.
* Knowledge of network communication, cloud infra, OS, API:s and applications.
* + 3 years of experience as a Security Analyst or similar area.


**Specific competence**
* Experience with SIEM and logging environments for threat analysis, investigation, threat hunting and triage analysis on various security solution such as WAF, Bot Management, EDR.
* Understand attack mitigations and improvements related to OWASP
* Experience with Content Delivering Networks (CDN)
* Experience in cloud-based computing on large scale (preferably Microsoft Azure, but also GCP or AWS)
* Understanding of threat landscape, trends and act proactively on threat intelligence
* Good understanding of fundamental infrastructure components, network concepts, Operating Systems (Windows & Linux), DNS, etc.
* Willing to work in a team-oriented environment and flexibility to work in a demanding environment, sometimes under time-pressure.


**Additional Information**
**WHO WE ARE**
 H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.
   

  

**WHY YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE**
**Benefits**
 We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.
   

  

*In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.*
**Inclusion & Diversity**
*H&M is a part of H&M Group. At H&M Group, we’re determined to create and maintain inclusive, diverse and equitable workplaces throughout our organisation. Our teams should consist of a variety of people that share and combine their knowledge, experience and ideas. Having a diverse workforce leads to a positive impact on how we address challenges, on what we perceive possible and on how we choose to relate to our colleagues and customers all over the world. Hence all diversity dimensions are taken into consideration in our recruitment process.*
*We are committed to a recruitment process that is fair, equitable, and based on competency. We therefore kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application.*

title: Technical Account Manager
description:
**Description**
 An AWS Technical Account Manager is a trusted advisor and cloud operations architect for our Enterprise Support customers. As a trusted advisor you’ll have a direct impact in helping our customers gain the most value from cloud technology. You’ll craft and execute strategies to drive our customers’ adoption and use of AWS services. You will provide advocacy and strategic technical guidance to help plan and build solutions using best practices, and proactively keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will allow you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS.
   

  

 Our Technical Account Managers partner with some of the most iconic businesses in the country. These range from rising startups building their business from scratch through to large enterprises going through significant transformation. You’ll provide advice on architecture, support strategy, project, and launch planning as well as ongoing operational issues.
   

  

 AWS Sales, Marketing, and Global Services (SMGS) is responsible for driving revenue, adoption, and growth from the largest and fastest growing small- and mid-market accounts to enterprise-level customers including public sector.
   

  

 The AWS Global Support team interacts with leading companies and believes that world-class support is critical to customer success. AWS Support also partners with a global list of customers that are building mission-critical applications on top of AWS services.
   

  

 Key job responsibilities
   

  

* You’ll build solutions, provide technical guidance and advocate for the customer
* Ensure AWS environments remain operationally healthy whilst reducing cost and complexity
* Develop trusting relationships with customers, understanding their business needs and technical challenges
* Using your technical acumen and customer obsession, you’ll drive technical discussions regarding incidents, trade-offs, and risk management
* Consult with a range of partners from developers through to C-suite executives
* Collaborate with AWS Solutions Architects, Business Developers, Professional Services Consultants, and Sales Account Managers
* With a bias for action, you'll proactively find opportunities for customers to gain additional value from AWS
* Solve a variety of problems across different customers as they migrate their workloads to the cloud
* Uplift customer capabilities by running workshops and other enablement sessions.


 As we continue to rapidly expand in EMEA, you’ll have plenty of opportunities to develop your technical, consulting and leadership skills. You’ll work with talented cloud technologists whilst expanding your knowledge of AWS products. You’ll also have the chance to receive mentor-ship and gain AWS certifications.
   

  

 Do you want to be part of history and transform businesses through cloud computing adoption? We would love to hear from you.
   

  

**About The Team**
 About AWS
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role as a Technical Account Manager, Consultant, Solutions Architect, Platform Engineer, Systems Engineer, Cloud Architect etc.
* Understand operational parameters and troubleshooting for 2 or more of the following: Compute, Storage, Networking, CDN, Databases, DevOps, Big Data and Analytics, Security, Applications Development
* Internal enterprise or external customer-facing experience with the ability to clearly articulate to small and large audiences
* Ability to juggle tasks and projects in a fast-paced environment
* Customer obsessed


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Professional experience with cloud offerings such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform etc.
* Programming or scripting skills with a combination of Java, Python Perl, Ruby, C#, and/or PHP a plus but not a requirement
* Previous experience as a Software Engineer, Developer, DevOps Engineer etc.
* Understanding of DevOps practices and tools including Continuous Integration / Deployment, Puppet, Docker, Kubernetes, Chef is a plus


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information. If the country/region you’re applying in isn’t listed, please contact your Recruiting Partner.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Atlassian Consultant
description:
**Introduction to Eficode**
 We are building the future of software development - specialising in Cloud, DevOps, Agile, and Development. We help our customers transform into software-driven organisations, aiming to change the world by sharing our knowledge. Our employees value: opportunities for growth, emphasis on mental wellbeing, and a supportive, autonomous team culture.
   

  

 Now, we're hiring for a talented and driven 'Experienced Atlassian Consultant' to join our Sweden team - does this sound like you? Apply today!
   

  

**Role purpose**
 As an experienced Atlassian Consultant at Eficode, you will help clients optimize their software development and collaboration workflows using Atlassian tools like Jira, Confluence, and Bitbucket. With your deep technical expertise and strategic mindset, you’ll provide tailored solutions and drive the integration of these tools with other enterprise systems, such as ServiceNow and Azure DevOps. You’ll collaborate with clients to understand their needs and implement best practices to maximize efficiency and scalability.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on complex, high-impact projects alongside a team of experienced specialists, continuously learning and sharing knowledge. Your contributions will help organizations transform into agile, software-driven enterprises, while also advancing your career in a dynamic, growth-focused environment at Eficode.
   

  

**Role Responsibilities**
*Your main responsibilities will include (but won’t be limited to):*
* Work closely with customers providing expert guidance on Atlassian product implementations and customizations
* Use your skills to tailor solutions for Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket, and other Atlassian products
* Lead and/or participate in complex implementations of ITSM and DevOps solutions in large and mid-sized organizations
* Design and implement integrations between Atlassian tools and other enterprise systems such as ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, or other enterprise systems
* Collaborate with a team of experienced Atlassian specialists to solve technical challenges and drive best practices for customers
* Be an Atlassian certified expert with the skills to support and implement best-in-class solutions


**Success factors**
*You will make a great match for this role if you have:*
* Extensive experience as a consultant and well established apps related to the Atlassian Platform
* Technical background, with experience in scripting, automation, and/or systems integration or system development in general
* Understanding of ITIL practices or experience from ITSM organisations
* Understanding of Agile practices or ways of working
* Understanding of related tools (for instance GitHub, Azure DevOps, Bitbucket or others) and the enterprise tooling landscape as a whole
* A problem-solving mindset
* A desire to continuously learn and keep up to date with the development of the Atlassian platform


**Desired Skills And Qualifications**
*It would be an added bonus if you have:*
* Experience working in or leading projects and technical implementations
* Understanding of the software development lifecycle
* Atlassian certifications, accreditations or badges


**About You**
*The type of person we're looking for has:*
* A problem-solving mindset
* A desire to continuously learn and keep up to date with the development of the Atlassian platform
* A good team player
* An eagerness to share knowledge with peers and clients


**What’s in it for you?**
* Be part of a leading DevOps and Atlassian consulting company with over 650 experts across 10 countries
* Work with exciting customers across industries and tackle complex system implementation projects
* Grow your career in a learning driven culture with opportunities for training, certifications, and knowledge sharing
* With over 90 colleagues in Sweden, we have offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Malmö and Sundsvall. Our flexible and open work culture, focus on continuous learning, and industry leading expertise make us a great place to grow your career..


**At Eficode, We Offer**
* A flexible and dynamic work environment with opportunities for remote work.
* A strong learning culture, with access to certifications, training, and conferences.
* A team of driven and experienced colleagues who support and challenge each other.
* A company where your expertise makes a difference – influence solutions and drive innovation.


**Location**
 This role will be based in Sweden and will have a hybrid working model.
   

  

**DEI Statement**
 At Eficode we are committed to offering an inclusive recruitment process and equal opportunities for all applicants. We are dedicated to creating a work environment that embraces diversity, inclusion, and respect for all employees. We believe that our differences make us better. We recognise that by having diverse perspectives, skills, ages, genders, backgrounds, and cultures, we will better drive our customers forward and innovate in our field.
   

  

 To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from sharing unnecessary personal information or an image of yourself in your job application.

title: Solutions Architect Enterprise, AWS Sweden
description:
**Description**
 Are you passionate about cloud technology and helping customers innovate?
   

  

 Join our AWS Solutions Architecture team in Sweden and empower large enterprises across industries to innovate at speed and scale with cloud technologies.
   

  

 Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.
   

  

 They work to understand the customer's business needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with technology. They help customer's validate their initiatives from ideation to proof of concept. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, Industry experts, support, service teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.
   

  

 Amongst others you will be part of design and building reference architectures, proof of concepts and deploy production workloads on AWS. Provide thought leadership and recommendations on cloud architecture, migration, modernization and operation. Build strong technical relationships acting as the voice of the customer internally to influence AWS service roadmaps.
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

 AWS Global Sales drives adoption of the AWS cloud worldwide, enabling customers of all sizes to innovate and expand in the cloud. Our team empowers every customer to grow by providing tailored service, unmatched technology, and unwavering support. We dive deep to understand each customer's unique challenges, then craft innovative solutions that accelerate their success. This customer-first approach is how we built the world's most adopted cloud. Join us and help us grow.
   

  

**About The Team**
 The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn. You will have the support to grow your expertise. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments. At AWS you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.
   

  

 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 AWS values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS?
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 AWS values curiosity and connection. Our employee-led and company-sponsored affinity groups promote inclusion and empower our people to take pride in what makes us unique. Our inclusion events foster stronger, more collaborative teams. Our continual innovation is fueled by the bold ideas, fresh perspectives, and passionate voices our teams bring to everything we do.
   

  

 Mentorship & Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Background in Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps across industries.
* Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience
* Experience in managing complex sales processes with both technical and non-technical stakeholders
* Demonstrated ability to think strategically about business, product and technical challenges
* English business level communication skills written and verbal


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Prior domain experience in enterprise cloud adoption and operating production workloads on AWS
* Knowledge of cloud native design patterns, DevOps practices and AWS services
* Experience with or understanding of common enterprise regulations, security and compliance standards
* Public speaking experience or passion for creating technical content


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

 Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need a workplace accommodation or adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please visit https://amazon.jobs/content/en/how-we-hire/accommodations for more information.
