title: Senior Staff Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

**The Role:**
 We're seeking a skilled Software Engineer to join our Graph team and enhance the search functionality within our multi-tenant service. This role requires significant experience designing, implementing, and maintaining Elasticsearch/OpenSearch in a production environment. You will own projects from initial requirements gathering (PRD) through to successful completion, collaborating with customers to ensure solutions meet their specific needs.
   

  

 As part of our team, you'll contribute to building cutting-edge features leveraging serverless compute, auto-scaling OpenSearch clusters, and LLMs with Machine Learning nodes. We are a team that prioritizes high code quality in every commit.
   

  

**Why is this team critical to Optimizely?**
* Business Impact: Graph is the core content delivery and search service powering the SaaS version of our Content Management System (CMS). Our customers, who rely on Graph for their websites and mobile applications, demand high performance and advanced query capabilities to deliver exceptional user experiences. Graph's reliability and speed directly impact their business success.
* High Visibility & Innovation: Our roadmap prioritizes innovative content delivery and search features, placing search and AI at the forefront of our service offering. This focus differentiates us from competitors and empowers our customers to build cutting-edge web and mobile applications. You'll be instrumental in developing these differentiating features.
* Shape the Future of Digital Experiences: The team plays a critical role in shaping the future of our customers' digital presence. Your contributions will directly influence how they engage their audiences and achieve their business objectives through innovative search and content delivery experiences


**Experience Required:**
* 5+ years’ experience of developing and managing services in production
* Experience managing Elasticsearch / OpenSearch in production, with optimization of settings, shards, and replicas.
* Experience creating optimized Elasticsearch / OpenSearch queries
* Experience developing with TypeScript
* Expertise with API design and development of GraphQL or RESTful web services
* Partnering closely with internal stakeholders to gain a strong understanding of business and product data needs
* You find satisfaction in being a force multiplier for your colleagues
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science or engineering or related experience require


**Some technologies we work with:**
* Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* GraphQL, REST
* TypeScript, JavaScript, C#
* Cloudflare workers, Kubernetes


**What sets you apart:**
* Experience developing GraphQL APIs
* Experience in Kubernetes, Docker etc. and/ or serverless cloud stacks
* Experience developing multi-tenant services
* Experience of Machine Learning in Elasticsearch / OpenSearch
* Experience working with go-to-market teams
* Understanding the value of pair programming/TDD/Clean Code
* Exposure/Experience leveraging functional languages / paradigms


 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Senior Fullstack Developer - Node
description:
**At Hemnet, we're in the midst of an exciting transformation — rebalancing our tech stack to better support the future of our products and teams. As part of this journey, we’re starting to expand our tech stack from our existing Ruby-based architecture to modern, scalable services built with Node.js.** 
  

  

 To accelerate this shift and strengthen our capabilities, we’re now investing in growing by hiring additional Node.js developers.
   

  

**What’s in it for you?** 
  

  

* 🧪 Innovative Approach: Work with an experimental and iterative approach. Dare to explore uncharted territories, try something new, and surprise us all!
* 🔄 End-to-End Development: Develop and maintain our products from idea to production
* 🫂 Inclusive Culture: Enjoy a friendly, inclusive, and caring company culture where transparency, work-life balance, and well-being are high priorities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, or background
* ⚗️ Lab Weeks: Participate in recurring lab weeks—time for our developers to experiment, hack around, and evaluate creative ideas. Unleash Your Inner Mad Scientist—innovation starts here!
* 🛠️ Autonomy: Be part of a team that controls its own product decisions


  

  

**What you will do:** 
  

  

* Contribute to the continuous improvement of existing products and the development of new ones within the product team
* Collaborate closely with designers, product managers, and stakeholders to shape product vision and technical direction
* Participate in discussions and decisions related to architecture, implementation, and prioritization
* Take ownership of code quality, performance, and maintainability through testing, reviews, and refactoring
* Support and maintain production systems, ensuring reliability and stability
* Foster strong cross-functional relationships and actively contribute to a collaborative team culture
* Node.js Journey: Play a central role in our Node.js journey. While we have some services already running in production, this is just the beginning


  

  

**We believe you are:** 
  

  

 We see that you are an experienced developer with documented, commercial experience of working with the Node ecosystem. As our current architecture still includes Ruby components, we think that you are willing to learn and navigate the Ruby code base.
   

  

* Experience from data-driven product development with short iterations and experimentation
* Team Collaboration: Experience working in team settings, especially in medium to large multicultural/global companies
* Extensive experience and proficiency with other programming languages and eco systems. Meritorious frameworks: NestJS, Ruby on Rails, Typescript, React, and Next.js


  

  

**Your technical expertise likely includes several of the following areas:** 
  

  

* JavaScript – Proficiency in ES5, ES6+, and asynchronous programming
* Node.js – In-depth knowledge of Node.js and its ecosystem and frameworks (e.g., NestJS)
* Web Applications – Proven experience in driving architecture and system design, as well as developing and maintaining complex web-based applications in production environments
* RESTful APIs – Experience in designing and implementing RESTful APIs
* GraphQL – Familiarity with best practices for implementing and maintaining GraphQL APIs
* Database Management – Proficiency with relational databases such as PostgreSQL
* Cloud Services – Familiarity with AWS, Docker, and CircleCI, including deployment and scaling of Node.js services in cloud environments
* Testing and Debugging – Skilled in testing and debugging Node.js applications to ensure performance and reliabilit


  

  

**🏡 Your career at Hemnet** 
  

  

 With over 40 million visits each month, you’ll be part of Sweden’s most popular property platform – and one of the world’s most admired real estate platforms. But our size and reputation aren’t the only reasons why you and your 150+ colleagues enjoy working here.
   

  

 Since 1998, Hemnet has been an essential go-to place for millions of Swedes, guiding them through one of life’s biggest transitions: finding a new place to call home. We’re proud to make this life-changing, often stressful journey as seamless as possible.
   

  

 With access to vast amounts of data, you’ll have limitless opportunities to explore and create new features that enhance the experience for Sweden’s real estate agents, home buyers, and sellers.
   

  

 Our friendly Hemnet culture fosters a dynamic, playful environment where every voice is valued. Here, you’ll join a welcoming team that encourages you to thrive and grow, working alongside passionate colleagues from around the world.
   

  

**A Hybrid Way of Working** 
  

  

 Our vibrant office in central Stockholm is the hub of our collaboration and culture, providing a lively space that fosters team spirit. We come together in the office three days a week, with two flexible remote days. To be part of our team, it’s essential to be based in or near Stockholm.

title: Business Central Developer
description:
**🎉 ERP Superstar (Microsoft Business Central) – Join the Colorful Chaos! 🎉**
 At Happy Socks, we believe life’s too short for boring socks—or boring workdays.
   

  

 We’re a fashion brand on a mission to spread happiness and color to every corner of the world. We design and sell bold, high-quality products that make people smile, and we do it through our own stores, website, and global wholesale partners. Behind the scenes, our tech team keeps the (striped, polka-dotted, pineapple-covered) engine running—powering digital innovation, improving how we work, and making sure our supply chain is as smooth as a perfectly folded pair of socks.
   

  

 Right now, we’re looking for a Microsoft Business Central wizard (that’s you!) to join our team and help us scale smarter, faster, and more colorfully.
   

  

**🧦 What You’ll Do (aka your sock drawer of responsibilities):**
* Keep our ERP system (Microsoft Business Central) running like a dream—no holes, no mismatches.
* Improve, tweak, and tech-tinker integrations with other internal and external systems.
* Work your magic across teams—especially with our Finance and Retail folks—to turn business needs into technical solutions.
* Be a key player in system-related projects, from the brainstorm phase to test flights.
* Offer hands-on support to users and help solve system mysteries, big or small.
* Monitor, analyze, and optimize our most critical processes (no pressure—you’ve got this).


**🎯 How You Work**
* You don’t just fix things—you improve them. Constantly.
* You have a sixth sense for spotting issues before they unravel and can stitch up solutions like a pro.
* You thrive in cross-functional chaos and like being the friendly face people turn to when tech gets tricky.
* Whether you’re deep-diving into code or jumping into a quick sync with a stakeholder, you bring that happy-get-it-done attitude.
* You’re not afraid to roll up your (striped) sleeves and dive into the details—or zoom out and see the bigger business picture.


**🎩 About You**
* You’ve got deep technical knowledge of Microsoft Business Central (especially Sales, Finance, and Logistics modules).
* You’re used to working in a dynamic environment and love making systems work for people—not the other way around.
* You’re a team player who’s not afraid to speak up, ask questions, or suggest weird-but-brilliant ideas.
* You enjoy working in a place where no two days are the same—and where socks occasionally show up in PowerPoints.


**🌈 Why You’ll Love It Here**
* We’re not your typical fashion brand. We’re a little wild, a little weird, and 100% dedicated to spreading happiness.
* You’ll be part of a tight-knit tech team where your ideas matter and your skills will shine.
* Hybrid work setup? Yep. Competitive salary? You bet. Fun colleagues, unexpected challenges, and colorful energy? Always.
* Oh—and a discount on the happiest socks you’ll ever wear.


 If this sounds like your kind of workplace, then pull up your brightest pair and hit “apply.” We can’t wait to meet you.
   

  

 Happy Socks aims to spread happiness by turning an everyday essential into a colorful design piece. The business is built on foundations of rigid quality standards, craftsmanship and creativity that are transferred into the products by a talented team of creatives. The products feature endless variations of models and designs, using a broad spectrum of color combinations and original patterns.

title: Data Engineer, Solna
company_industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description:
Do you want to be part of our in-house Machine Learning team and take part in PostNord’s digital transformation journey? Do you wish to work hands-on across the whole data engineering area? Then you should apply for this position as a Data Engineer!
   

  

 Join us
   

  

 The Machine Learning team’s main responsibility is to create production volume forecasts for PostNord production units. It is our goal to create machine learning models that deliver forecasts with high accuracy, that enables PostNord’s production units to plan staffing levels and truck utilization in the most efficient and environmentally friendly way.
   

  

 PostNord is the leader of logistics and postal services in the Nordics. As a part of the IT organization, we support a variety of different PostNord stakeholders in a multitude of areas, such as e.g. HR, mail and logistics. We are already delivering business critical forecasting models that are an important piece of the puzzle of optimizing our operations,
   

  

 Our digital transformation journey started a few years back with migrating BI/DW platforms to Azure and we are now using a modern infrastructure to build solutions that enables data-driven decision making.
   

  

 The team delivery consists of developing, training, running and monitoring time series-based volume forecasting, based on our vast amounts of historical data on logistics operations in the Nordics.
   

  

 Our technology is focused on the Azure stack, and includes Azure Auto ML, Azure ML Ops, Azure DevOps CI/CD, Power BI etc.
   

  

 This is a "hands-on" position requiring solid technical skills that allows working across the whole data engineering discipline. You will build and optimize complex data pipelines in Microsoft Azure and Databricks. You will work closely with other data analysts, forecasting specialists and data scientists to provide the required data models and data sets and enable the training of new machine learning models. You will take part in building the cloud infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources to Azure. As a data engineer you will also be able to create visual data presentations in the form of dashboards and reports.
   

  

* A bachelor's degree or higher in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
* At least 3-5 years of experience in data engineering
* Experience in developing and deploying data pipelines in cloud-based environments (Azure preferred).
* Experience in building and optimizing data pipelines and data lakes/warehouses – in a cloud environment preferably Azure.
* Experience with ETL and data modelling.
* Experience in Azure ADF and Databricks.
* Strong understanding of core cloud concepts - Azure data storage, Azure compute, data connections and APIs.
* Proficiency in Python.
* Knowledge and exposure to structured and unstructured data, file formats, storage, etc.
* Experience in data modelling and with data visualization in Power BI or similar tool.
* Familiarity with modern data architecture, (MS SQL preferred).
* Communication skills in both written and spoken English.


 Meritorious experience
   

  

* Communication skills in both written and spoken Swedish.
* Experience in AGILE project methodology and practice.
* Prior experience implementing generative AI/LLM’s or ML.
* Experience in using containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, or Helm for building and deploying scalable and reproducible machine learning applications.
* Have worked with Azure ML Studio and Azure DevOps


 We accept applications from all of EU but would require a remote colleague to be willing to visit on site on a regular basis.
   

  

 We offer you
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment
* Wellness allowance & access to the office´s gym and health center (Solna).
* Employee benefits through PostNord’s own personnel foundation PostNord Plus.
* Great occupational pension terms.
* Great development opportunities and a continuous learning culture.
* Employment in Solna/Hybrid.


**About Us**
 We make everyday life easier! PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal- and logistic services to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region.
   

  

 Apply
   

  

 We look forward receiving your application! If you have any questions or concerns, you are welcome to contact Pernille Skovborg at pernille.skovborg@postnord.com.
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: www.postnord.com/fackliga

title: Senior Data Engineer to major automotive client
description:
**Do you want to help build a modern cloud-based data platform at one of Sweden’s largest automotive companies? In this role, you’ll be a key member of a BI/Analytics team driving the transition from legacy systems to a new AWS-based solution. You’ll work with data pipelines, reporting in Power BI, and ensure the business has access to accurate decision support in a rapidly evolving system landscape. We look forward to receiving your application!**
**About The Role**
 Our client is one of Sweden’s largest vehicle importers, delivering around 10 million vehicles to customers worldwide. For the past year, they’ve been implementing a modern data platform built on AWS. In parallel, a wide-scale transformation of the system landscape is underway, replacing many of the existing systems.
   

  

 To support this transition, the BI/Analytics team is now growing. The team’s core responsibilities include:
   

  

* Ingesting data from legacy systems into the new platform
* Creating Power BI reports that replace legacy reports in Report Manager and Qlik Sense — often consolidating multiple old reports into one, and incorporating new requirements
* Harmonizing data to ensure consistent tracking and reporting across old and new source systems
* Incident management, with minimal development on the legacy solution


 The team practices smart working — a hybrid setup with a few days per week onsite at the office in Södertälje, and the rest remote. The assignment starts immediately or in August, with an initial contract through the end of the year and the possibility of extension.
   

  

**Being a consultant at Nexer Tech Talent**
 You will be employed by Nexer Tech Talent and work as a consultant at our client’s site, starting immediately or after the summer. We will support and challenge you throughout the assignment, and you’ll have opportunities to join networking events, inspiring talks, and social activities that strengthen your role within our consultant team. As a senior consultant, you may also act as a mentor — sharing your knowledge and experience with junior colleagues.
   

  

**We're Looking For Someone Who Has**
* At least 5 years of experience designing and building scalable data pipelines in a modern, cloud-based data platform for analytics or advanced analytics
* Experience with AWS and the DBT tool
* A proactive mindset, with the ability to suggest improvements and share knowledge with the team
* Experience in data modeling
* Strong troubleshooting skills and a solution-oriented approach
* Experience working in large, complex projects
* Fluency in English (Swedish skills are a plus)


**Application**
 Does this sound like an exciting opportunity? We’re reviewing applications on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply! If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Tech Recruiter Molly Rytter at molly.rytter@nexergroup.com.
   

  

 We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**About Nexer Tech Talent**
 Nexer Tech Talent is part of Nexer Group — a tech company deeply rooted in Swedish entrepreneurship and innovation. With over 2,500 employees in 15 countries and more than 35 years of experience, we help our clients stay ahead — strategically, technologically, and communicatively. Learn more about Nexer Tech Talent here (link to be inserted).

title: 3DExperience DevOps within CAD/vPDM area for Scania IT
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 IT is a crucial part of this transformation as Scania’s success is depending on flexible and efficient IT solutions that support current and future business requirements.
   

  

 Globalisation, digitalisation and mobility are examples of trends that are affecting our business environment. We are increasing our ability to make use of our information assets and utilize new technology.
   

  

 The work environment at Scania is international and our employees are representing many different nationalities and countries. To this exciting and dynamic environment we are now looking for new team members!
   

  

**Do you thrive in an outgoing, inspiring and friendly atmosphere, are you unpretentious and happy to share your skills with your colleagues? Then this may be the PERFECT opportunity for you!**
**Job Responsibilities**
 We are currently looking for someone who is passionate about agile working methods, loves development and enjoys the challenge of getting people and technology to function as a team to achieve optimal results.
   

  

 We currently have many challenging and interesting initiatives ongoing such as:
   

  

  

* Replacing the existing CAD/PLM platform with a new one that supports us in having a digital thread/digital twin and being more data driven.
* Integration of brands within the TRATON group (SCANIA/MAN/VW truck & bus/International) to a common way of working with CAD/PLM.
* Setting up the process and IT solutions for supporting our business in China.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for an experienced DevOps engineer! Scania uses the Dassault Systemes application portfolio, prior experience of the platform is a prerequisite. You need to be proficient in written and spoken English, since it’s our corporate language.
   

  

 We expect that you have:
   

  

  

* 5+ years of experience of 3DExperience/Dassault Systemes platform.
* Good knowledge in GitLab/Jenkins/Perforce
* Good knowledge in CI/CD
* Good knowledge of Unix/Linux system administration.
* Good knowledge of Java Technologies including Tomcat/JSP
* Knowledge of Oracle databases
* Experience from Exalead/Impala is meritorious.


 We welcome applicants from all backgrounds – your unique experience and perspectives is valuable to us.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 You will join a DevOps team that works with development and support for R&D within Scania and the Traton Group. We work close to our customers and are involved in the entire system development process, from concept development to implementation and production. The team is responsible for implementing and maintaining of current and future IT services. You will play a central role in our DevOps team and will have many contacts around the Scania organisation. You will be involved in requirements, development, testing and release management.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-05-29. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Anna-Carin Markström (Manager), anna-carin.markstrom@scania.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Testare inom anestesi
company_industry: Medical Equipment Manufacturing, Biotechnology Research, and Hospitals and Health Care
description:
**Tillsammans gör vi skillnad**
 På Getinge är vi engagerade i att hjälpa våra kunder att rädda liv och säkerställa utmärkt vård. Vi erbjuder innovativa lösningar för operationsrum, intensivvårdsenheter, steriliseringsavdelningar och för Life Science och institutioner. Ett jobb hos Getinge kommer att ge dig karriärmöjligheter som både inspirerar och utmanar.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 På Getinge Critical Care i Solna utvecklas och tillverkas ventilatorer och anestesimaskiner till sjukvården. Vi söker nu en testare till ett av våra R&D team inom anestesi.
   

  

 Teamet består idag av 8 personer och ansvarar för Core SW, systemarkitektur, cyber security samt connectivity i våra anestesimaskiner. Din roll i detta team och inom anestesi är att testa Core SW tillsammans med lågnivå SW för att säkerställa kvaliteten på mjukvaran i våra maskiner.
   

  

 Inom R&D arbetar vi i tvärfunktionella team med såväl juniora som seniora ingenjörer inom olika kompetensområden.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter**
* Testa delsystems SW kopplat till Core och lågnivå
* Testa uppkopplade system och systemintegritet såsom connectivity och cyber security
* Inför releaser och formativa tester ingå i ett större testteam för att validera och verifiera system SW
* Skriva testspecifikationer/testfall samt exekvera/rapportera både för manuella och automatiska tester
* Dokumentation i våra kvalitetssystem
* Ett nära samarbete med systemarkitekt, SW-utvecklare och övrig testorganisation inom anestesi
* Delaktig i test och verifiering av framtidens generation samt den befintliga versionen av vår anestesimaskin
* Du kommer att arbeta på plats i våra nyrenoverade lokaler med möjlighet att arbeta på distans någon dag i veckan.


**Vad du har med dig**
 I den här rollen ser vi att du har följande med dig:
   

  

* Civil- eller Högskoleingenjörsexamen
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet inom test och verifiering.
* Goda kunskaper i något av språken eller ramverken kring C++/Python/Squish
* Erfarenhet av att testa inbyggda system
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Kunskap om Linux och ett intresse för CI/CD.
* Erfarenhet av SW utveckling eller framtagande samt testning av automationstestning.
* Erfarenhet av agil produktutveckling.
* Ett brinnande intresse för teknik och test.
* Erfarenhet av arbete inom medicinteknik.
* Erfarenhet av mätteknik kopplat till flöde, tryck, spänning etc.


 Förutom tekniska färdigheter värderar vi din personlighet högt. Som person tror vi att du är driven, nyfiken, engagerad samt positiv till nya idéer och arbetssätt Du är självgående och tar gärna egna initiativ. Du är van och trivs med att kommunicera med olika intressenter i en organisation tillika att samarbeta både i och utanför teamet. Vi tror att du har lätt för att lära dig nya tekniska områden och att du är bekväm i att fatta tekniska beslut.
   

  

 På Getinge omfamnar vi en lärandekultur där vi tar ansvar för vår utveckling och sätter stort värde på kvalitet och samarbete. Framför allt bryr vi oss om varandra för att vi som team och bolag ska kunna fortsatta utveckla världsledande produkter. Vi är Team Players, Forward Thinkers och Game Changers!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
 Vi erbjuder ett konkurrenskraftigt kompensations- och förmånspaket, inklusive friskvårdsbidrag, familjeförmåner och gemensamma aktiviteter och föreningsliv. Allt detta för att säkerställa att vi stöder ditt välbefinnande och dina mål.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder ett jobb i en säker och informell arbetsmiljö, där vi uppskattar en positiv inställning och ett nära teamsamarbete. Vi har en öppen dialog mellan ledare och medarbetare, samt mellan teamen. Vi fokuserar på att utveckla människor och tillsammans skapar vi en plan för lärande och kompetensutveckling när du börjar din karriär hos oss.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Ansökningar kommer att granskas löpande och vi rekommenderar därför att du skickar in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast 2025-06-05. Vi ber dig att skicka in din ansökan i vårt rekryteringssystem genom att klicka på knappen "ansök nu". På grund av GDPR tar vi inte emot ansökningar via e-post.
   

  

 Om du har några frågor angående rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Katarina Dahlén på katarina.dahlen@getinge.com eller rekryterare Sofia Ekstrand på sofia.ekstrand@getinge.com .
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan. Vi hoppas att du vill följa med oss på vår resa mot att bli världens mest eftertraktade medicintekniska företag.
